loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
Abbass is a 42-year-old married man and father of five children. Abbass has been working in vehicle repairs for 20 years; this long experience gave him his customers' trust and support.

Abbass is a hardworking man, well-known in his region. In 2010, Abbass opened his own garage. This step forward was an excellent one to take for his family's increase in income and for improving their living conditions.

Abbass applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy a used car with a special price to fix, sell and make a good profit. This kind of business will increase his income, and will also open for him a new business trend to invest in.

He hopes to expand his business more and more in the future and to attract new customers.

loans.use: To buy a car with a special price to repair and sell.

loans.name: Nelis Betania

texts.es:
En el municipio de Quezalguaque departamento de león, la señora Nelis trabaja como maestra de primaria  habiendo adquirido muchos honores por su dedicación y profesionalismo. Actualmente está dedicándose a esta labor desde hace 7 años, es Casada, tiene 1  hijo, y labora en un colegio de la localidad de quezalguaque.
Una de las necesidades que la señora Nelis  atraviesa hoy en día es de mejorar su vivienda en lo que a pared  se refiere, la que se encuentra en mal estado, ya que debido a esta necesidad  tomó la decisión de visitar Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como: Ladrillos,  ya que de esta manera mejorará sus condiciones  y nivel de vida, para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
In the town of Quezalguaque in the Department of León, Sra. Nelis works as an elementary school teacher. She has been awarded many honors for her dedication and professionalism. Nelis has been in this job now for seven years. She is married and has one child. Nelis works at a school in the town of Quezalguaque.

One of her needs at the moment is to make improvements to her home, especially the walls that are in bad condition. Therefore, she made the decision to visit CEPRODEL and request a loan to buy construction materials, such as bricks. This will improve the living conditions and the standard of living for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase bricks for renovations to her house.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 35 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Alicia is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs and fishing net.

Alicia has been raising pigs for seven years and earns additional income from fishing and food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save money to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins (for pigs) and fishing net.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 39 years old and a widowed mother of six children, of which two attend school. She has a rice farming business in the Philippines. Marilou is requesting a loan of PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marilou has been farming rice for 10 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 32 years old and married with two children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Mary runs a general store in the Philippines and is requesting a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, noodles, etc. 

In the future, Mary would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 52 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell in her store.

Nida has borrowed and paid back 13 loans from NWTF previously. She has been running the store for four years and also earns income from buying and selling fruits.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Martha Idalia

texts.es: Martha Idalia es una emprendedora que toda la vida ha luchado por tener una herramienta de trabajo para brindarle a su familia lo mejor, iniciando su propio negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general, que la tiene ubicada en su casa de habitación  y de forma ambulante, donde atiende a sus clientes y le ofrece variedad de producto. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de mercadería como pantalones, faldas, camisas, short, sandalias, trajes entre otros productos que más le solicitan.
texts.en:
Martha Idalia is an entrepreneur who has strived her entire life to obtain what she needs for her work so that she can provide the best for her family. She started her own business of selling general merchandise. Martha manages her business from her home and she also works as a traveling merchant, which enables her to serve her customers and provide them a variety of products.

She is currently requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as trousers, skirts, shorts, sandals, suits, and other products that are frequently requested.

loans.use: to buy trousers, skirts, shirts, shorts, sandals, suits, and other products.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 58 years old and married with 3 children.

Remedios works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her general store.

Remedios has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from boarding house renting.

Remedios aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego es un hombre de 23 años de edad y vive con su familia, en una comunidad de la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas llamada La Danta.  La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.

Diego está solicitando un préstamo de ₡600.000 (seiscientos mil colones), para  la cosecha de frijol y darle mantenimiento a su siembra por medio de abono y fungicidas para proteger sus cultivos de plagas y hongos que puedan afectar la producción mientras se desarrolla,  gracias a este préstamo podrá seguir desarrollando esta actividad y sembrando estos productos pues esta labor es precisamente la que le permite llevar el sustento a su familia. 

El es socio como muchos otros agricultores de la zona de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de la Danta S.A, una de las 150 empresas de crédito comunal de Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Diego is a 23-year-old gentleman who lives with his family in a community called La Danta, which is located in Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas, in the southern part of Costa Rica. The local economy is based on agricultural activities, such as livestock breeding and the cultivation of crops such as tubers, coffee, corn, and beans.

Diego is requesting a loan of 600,000 CRC so that he can plant beans and maintain his crop. In order to do this, he will buy compost and fungicides to protect his crops from pests and fungi that could affect them as they develop and impact production. Thanks to his loan, Diego will be able to continue developing his business and producing crops. His work enables him to support his family.

Like many other farmers in the area, Diego is a member of the Communal Credit Enterprise of La Danta, S.A., one of the 150 Communal Bank throughout Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farming supplies for planting beans.

loans.name: Milagro Sulema

texts.es:
Doña Milagro de 51 años de edad, es casada, ella vive en una aldea de San Lorenzo Valle. Ella se dedica al comercio como ser la venta de refrescos, agua, churros, jugos, huevos, etc. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura ya que es su mayor apoyo que ella tiene porque con los ingresos que obtiene de sus labores puede sacar adelante con sus estudios a sus hijos. 
Doña milagro esta solicitando un crédito de 4,000.00 lempiras para la compra de refrescos ya que con el  apoyo de este crédito sus ventas aumentaría y sus ingresos serán mejores porque tendrá mas mercadería y habrá mas demanda de sus clientes.
El sueño de Doña Milagro es que su negocio cresca y que sus hijos se puedan graduar, y también  poder mejorar su vivienda.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - abril 2012
texts.en:
Doña Milagro is 51 years old, married, and lives in the neighborhood of San Lorenzo Valle. She is a merchant who sells soft drinks, water, donuts, juices, eggs, and other products. Her husband is a farmer and he is the main support that she has since the income he earns from his work enables their children to move forward with their studies.

Doña Milagro is requesting a loan of 4,000 HNL in order to buy soft drinks. The help from this loan will increase her sales and improve her income since she will have more merchandise and be able to meet the demands of her customers. Her dream is to grow her business and see her children graduate. She would also like to make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks.

loans.name: Saripa

texts.en:
Saripa is 26 years old and married with one child.

Saripa works hard to provide for her family. She runs an ambulant general store in the Philippines and requests a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Saripa has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the ambulant general store for two years and also earns an income from buying and selling copras.

Saripa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a 33-year-old divorced woman who is struggling to prove to herself that she can be productive and doesn't need others help to make her living.

Linda has worked as a tailor for five years, and she also works in a library to make her living. To improve her business, Linda applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order buy a new tailoring machine in order to improve her quality of work, and to decrease the time needed to finish a certain request.

Linda will also invest part of the loan in starting a new trade - she will support a lot to expand in the future. She has no idea as of now what she will sell but she said that when the cash is available, you can start any business with special offers.

Linda hopes to open a cloth-selling shop in the future to please her customers as much as she can.

loans.use: to buy a new tailoring machine and start a new business.

loans.name: Srey Nith

texts.en:
Srey Nith, 19, is married, and resides with her husband and one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia.

She has been selling groceries for more than two years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband is an arc welder who earns about USD 9 per day. In order to improve her husband’s business, Srey Nith is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more steel to use in her husband's business. This purchase will help her husband run his business well and earn more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand the business and send her child to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house next year.

loans.use: to purchase more steel to use in her husband's business.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainabu is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past six years, she has operated a food stall business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a café in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase plates, wheat flour and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase plates, wheat flour and beans.

loans.name: Sanobar

texts.ru:
Санобар успешная,умная,пунктуальная женщина,в возрасти 37 лет.Замужем и на иждивении имеет двоих детей.Она очень трудолюбивая и в поисках источника дохода Санобар с 2000 года начала свой бизнес на продовольственном рынке.С целью расширения своего бизнеса в 2004 году она обратилась в организацию "Арванд". Получив первый займ 
она оптом закупила хоз товары для продажи и с тех пор она кредитуеться в нашей организации и доказала свою добросовестность и ответственность.На данный момент у нее товарооборот более 16000 сомони.Санобар запрашивает кредит в размере 10000 сомони для увеличения товарооборота.Она надеется на вашу поддержку и помощь.
texts.en:
Sanobar is a successful and punctual woman, she is 37 years old. She is married and has two children. She is very hardworking and while looking for a source of income Sanobar started her business in 2000 on the food market. With a goal to grow her business in 2004 she has come to organization "Arvand."

After receiving her first loan she purchased household products in wholesale for resale and since then she has been taking out loans at our organization and has proven her integrity and responsibility. At this time her commodity circulation is more than 16,000 somoni. Sanobar is asking for a loan in the amount of 10,000 somoni to increase her commodity circulation. She is hoping for your help and support.

loans.use: for the purchase of household goods.

loans.name: Naet

texts.en:
Naet, 48, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

Naet has been involved in an agricultural business for more than ten years, has extensive experience, and is successful in her career. She is involved in growing rice and fattening up animals. She earns approximately  USD 9 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Her children are still in her care and in school. 

In order to improve her family’s economy, Naet is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase chickens to resale for a profitable price. By doing so, she would earn more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to purchase chickens to resale for a profitable price

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 30 year old married man, who has worked as a blacksmith for eighteen years. His long experience is enough to gain customers trust and support. In 2001 he started his own business, and he works on improving and developing it as much as he can.

Today Mahmoud is applying for a Youth Loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary iron, materials and tools highly requested in his business. Mahmoud is applying for a loan for the first time from Al Majmoua, and he hopes it will be with very impressive feedback to encourage him for future relationships.

He hopes to improve his business and living as much as he can, and to expand his working place.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials and tools for his blacksmith business

loans.name: Chean

texts.en:
Chean, 57, is widowed and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than twenty years, earning approximately USD 2 per day. Her children are employed in a shoe factory. They earn about USD 10 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Chean is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the money saved on her transportation expenses to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to build a new house to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Amara

texts.en:
Amara, 41, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for many years, earning approximately USD 6 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. One of her children is employed in Korea, and he earns about USD 20 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s economy, Amara is requesting a loan of USD 1500 to purchase more groceries for resale. This purchase will her help her expand her grocery store and generate more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resell

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married and has one child.

Alaa recently opened his own shop, selling mobile phones, phone accessories and rechargeable cards. He has sufficient experience in this field, has a good reputation and he is being well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $2400 loan in order to repair his shop, fix the walls, floors and to install more shelves. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order to repair his shop, fix the walls, floors and to install more shelves.

loans.name: Delaila

texts.en:
Delaila is married and blessed with one child. Her priority in life is to give the best way of living to her son. Her husband is a patient man who is engaged in a retailing business of dry goods in their village. With her determination to help her husband in carrying their needs, Delaila engaged herself in a livestock business. 

At present, Delaila encounters a shortage in financing her hogs feed. Since this is a source of income where she can apply her expertise, she wishes to maintain the business. Delaila decided to borrow a loan amounting to P40,000 to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her hogs. She hopes that through her business, she will help her husband and further support her child's needs.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her hogs.

loans.name: Mwaminifu Group

texts.en:
Mwajuma, who is in her mid 30s, is married with five children who are still going to school.  She has been running a genge-duka (retail and fruits and vegetables in the same shop) business for eight years now.  She works from 6.00 am to 8.00pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her 4th loan fro Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase on the missing items in the genge-duka, started selling charcoal, paid household expenses and has paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to buy more items for the genge-duka and more sacks of charcoal to resell. Her dream is to one day be able to own a Tigo Pesa (mobile phone and finance) business. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Mwaminifu" which has a total of 13 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more items for the genge-duka and more sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en:
Nabil is a 44 year old married man, and father of three children. He has been working in the food business for 25 years. In 2000 Nabil opened his own specialized bean restaurant; this kind of food is highly requested in Lebanon since it is a main breakfast plate, especially among families during the weekends. 

Nabil is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua for the first time, in order to pay for his children's school fees. His business is going on just fine but an unexpected raise in school fees requires external support.

Nabil loves his business a lot, since he loves communicating with others. He hopes he can improve and develop his business more and more in the future to keep his customers pleased and satisfied.

loans.use: To pay for his children School fess

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
Remy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Remy has been in this business for 10 years, and she earns more income from raising pigs and fishing.

She is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell for her fish vending business. Remy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 45 years old and married with 4 children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Melinda has been raising pigs for one year and also earns additional income from fishing and a general store.

Melinda is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Judith Adriana

texts.es:
Judith es una joven de 19 años entusiasta y trabajadora, humilde y sencilla, vive al lado de su madre a la cual apoya mucho con los ingresos de su pequeño negocio ya que su madre trabaja como empleada del hogar y sus ingresos son muy pequeños; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de imperial, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido hermosas playas y también por sus actividades como la agricultura y el comercio. Con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro Judith logro tener su negocio de venta de ropa en un pequeño puesto en el mercado; al principio fue un poco difícil ya que no tenía mucho conocimiento del negocio pero gracias a su habilidad y sobre todo esas ganas que tiene de salir adelante fue aprendiendo poco a poco, su negocio ya lleva un año y ella cree que le va bien porque es amable con los clientes y ofrece prendas de calidad a un precio cómodo.

Judith está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio, en especial ropa de invierno ya que la temporada está muy cerca; esta mejora le permitirá tener mayor variedad de productos y poder mejorar sus ingresos para así seguir luchando día a día para conseguir hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Ser el orgullo de su mami y darle una buena  calidad de vida”.
texts.en: Judith is 19 years old, enthusiastic and hardworking. Humble and simple, she lives with her mother, whom she helps a lot thanks to the income derived from her small shop, since her mother works as a cleaning lady and her income is meagre. She lives in Imperial, a city blessed with warm weather, beautiful beaches, agricultural and commercial activities. Judith went through a lot of efforts and had to save money to set up her own business of selling clothes from a small stand at the market. It was difficult at first because she did not know much about business, but thanks to her cleverness and desire to get ahead she has been learning more and more. Her business is now one year old and she attributes its success to her being nice to her customers and selling quality clothing at affordable prices. Judith is very grateful for Kiva's help, which has enabled her to buy more supplies for her shop, particularly winter clothing, as this season draws nearer. This improvement will enable her to offer a greater variety of products and she will be able to increase her income, which will in turn help her in her daily struggle to make her greatest dream come true : "to make my mum proud and give her a good quality of life".

loans.use: to buy supplies (winter clothing).

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 32 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines and has requested a 26,000 PHP loan through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.
Rowena has borrowed and paid back 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her charcoal retail business for four years and also earns an income from selling "birds' nest" (cave swifts' saliva).
Rowena aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
This is Jennifer, 32, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Marianito, a cook, and is the mother of three children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  
Jennifer runs a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most families only eat home-cooked meals in the evenings when all the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of time and money to spend money on cooking gas and food for one to two people when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Jennifer's regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.
To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP. She will be using the loan to buy more products such as meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  
Jennifer hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 39-year-old married man and a father of three children. He has been selling fruits and vegetables for 20 years. He started his own business in 2001.
Mahmoud is a hardworking man, with a good reputation. He is well known in the region for his special customer service and the quality of products he sells, in addition to his affordable prices.
Mahmoud is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to increase his business capital with special spring/summer fruits and vegetables.
Mahmoud's customers are loyal to him since he serves them best in the market. Mahmoud is planning to expand his business more and more and hopes to start wholesale trade in the future.

loans.use: to increase his business capital with special spring products.

loans.name: Dong

texts.en: Dong, 51, is married, and lives with her husband and three children in Takeo province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than 20 years, earning approximately USD $4 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about USD $4 per day. One of her children is a garment worker who earns about USD $5 per day. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Dong is requesting a loan of USD $300 to purchase cattle to use in her farming work as well as to resale for a profitable price. By doing so, she would earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children achieve bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new, bigger house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for use in her farming work as well as to resale for a profitable price.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les quatre femmes du groupe Benkadi ont  en moyenne 29 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de Dallan dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de leurs activités professionnelles et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente de céréales, d’habits de poissons et de la restauration. 
Dans le but de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles de plus en plus nombreuses et exigeantes, les membres du groupe ont décidé  d’intégrer  le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  1er  prêt solidaire.
Madame,   Hawa  (2 eme  femme debout de la droite  vers la gauche sur la photo) excelle dans la vente de céréales. Elle est très sollicitée dans son quartier à travers la bonne qualité de ses marchandises. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 500 kg de riz décortiqué avec les grossistes de SAN. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle mixtes à son domicile. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame Hawa espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 12500 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement correcte de son prêt, être réinvesti dans l’activité et  aider son conjoint dans la prise en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The four women who make up the Benkadi group are married in mainly large families, and have an average age of 29 and an average of three children. They all live in the village of Dallan in the region of Ségou (the fourth-largest administrative region in Mali), and know each other because they are neighbors, work together or are related. They buy and sell cereals, clothing and fish, or work in the food-serving business.
To meet the needs of their growing and demanding customer base, the members of the group have decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit program. This is their first group loan.
Hawa (the second woman standing from right to left in the photo) excels in the sale of cereals. She is much sought-after in her neighborhood due to the high quality of her products.
She plans to use her loan to buy 500 kg of husked rice from wholesalers located in San. She makes cash, retail and credit sales from her own home to a mix of customers.
With this loan Hawa hopes to make an average monthly profit of 12,500 francs CFA. She plans to use the money she earns to repay her loan, invest in her business and help her spouse meet the household expenses.

loans.use: To buy cereals.

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les dix femmes du groupe Benkan ont  en moyenne 46 ans et 8 enfants. Elles habitent toutes Kayantona, un des quartier de la ville de San et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente de poissons, de  céréales, d’habits de condiments alimentaires, des fruits et légumes et de la restauration. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  6 eme  prêt solidaire. Les  prêts  précédents ont été remboursés sans aucune difficulté.
Madame, MAMOU (1ere femme debout de droite vers la gauche  sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiments dans le quartier kayantona de et ses alentours. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 5 sacs d’oignons frais 3 cartons de cube maggi 2 sacs de sel de 25 kg chacun  15 kg de poivre et une grande quantité d’autres  condiments alimentaires à la foire de San., elle vend a domicile dans son quartier  au comptant, en détail et quelque fois à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement  de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame MAMOU espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 19500 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The ten women who make up the Benkan group are married in mainly large families, and have an average age of 46 and an average of eight children. They all live in Kayantona, a neighborhood in the town of San, and are all either neighbors or related to one another. They buy and sell fish, cereals, clothing, seasonings, fruit and vegetables, or work in the food-serving business.
The members of the group joined Soro Yiriwaso to expand their businesses. This is their sixth group loan, and they have correctly repaid their previous loans without difficulty.
Mamou (the first woman standing from right to left in the photo) is a successful seasoning seller in the Kayantona neighborhood and the surrounding area.
She plans to use her loan to buy five bags of fresh onions, three boxes of Maggi bouillon cubes, two 25-kg bags of salt, 15 kg of pepper and a large quantity of other seasonings at San market. She makes her sales from home in her neighborhood on a cash, retail and occasionally credit basis, selling her products to customers who are primarily women.
With this loan Mamou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 19,500 francs CFA, which she plans to reinvest in her business and also use to meet her household expenses.

loans.use: To buy seasonings.

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les six femmes du groupe DEMBAGNOUMA ont  en moyenne 42 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes la ville de SAN et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente de  condiments alimentaires et le commerce d’articles divers. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont adhéré  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  1 er   prêt solidaire.
Madame, OUMOU (2eme  femme debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) excelle dans la vente d’articles divers et de Bazin. Elle est très sollicitée dans le grand marché de San  et ses environnants.. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3 douzaines de tasses en plastiques,  ½ douzaines de gobelets en plastiques, 5 douzaines de seaux et 20 complets de BAZIN    auprès des grossistes à KOUTIALA. et à BAMAKO Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame  OUMOU  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 41000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et  aider son conjoint dans la prise en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The six women who make up the Dembagnouma group are married in mainly large families, and have an average age of 42 and an average of four children. They all live in the town of San, and are either neighbors or related to one another. They buy and sell seasonings and miscellaneous articles.
The group joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance program to expand their business, and this is their first group loan.
Oumou (the second woman standing from left to right in the photo) excels in the sale of miscellaneous articles and damask fabric. She is much sought-after in the grand market of San and the surrounding areas.
She plans to use her loan to purchase three dozen plastic containers, half a dozen plastic cups, five dozen buckets and 20 standard lengths of damask from wholesalers in Koutiala and Bamako. She makes cash, retail and credit sales to customers who are both male and female.
With this loan Oumou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 41,000 francs CFA, which she plans to reinvest in her business and help her spouse to meet the household expenses.

loans.use: To buy various articles.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario has been operating a small store in front of her house at Amulung. She is 49 years old, married and has four children. Two of them still attend school and are supported by Rosario. She is married to Celestino, a farmer in their village. They work untiringly to provide sustenance for the family. 

Rosario would like to improve her small store and stock more merchandise to sell and able to increase her earnings too. She is now borrowing a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, biscuits, soap, and shampoo to sell to her customers. Another part of the loan will be used for her spouse's farming business: she will buy fertilizers for the rice crop.

With good profits from their businesses, Rosario hopes to achieve a prosperous life for her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, biscuits, soap, and shampoo

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
This is Marlyn, 59, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Doroteo, a driver, and is mother to four children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Marlyn maintains a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and others. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers count on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 5,000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 28,000 PHP loan. She will utilize the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Marlyn hopes to grow her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise items and products to sell in her business.

loans.name: Kinole Group

texts.en:
Zainabu, who is in her late 20s, is married and has two children. One of her children goes to school; another one is a baby. She has been a food vendor for one year now. She works from 6:00 am to 7:00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use to increase her stock of food to sell to more people. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Kinole," which has a total of 18 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to purchase food for her business

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase fishing materials like a fishing net, bamboo, etc. for her fishing business.

Melody has been in this business for two years. Melody earns more income from buying and selling charcoal. Melody has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase fishing materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for more dishes and utensils

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna owns a small retail store in the village where she lives. She is married to Tito, and they have one child who is in college. Myrna works all day in her store just to meet the demand of the customers who come into her store. She is able to earn 7,000 PHP each month from her business. 

Now, she is looking to improve her sales. She would like to borrow a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy canned goods, soft drinks, milk, eggs, breads, and noodles to sell in her store.

She hopes to continue to acquire a good income from her business and, someday soon, to achieve financial stability. She also would like to keep providing friendly services to her customers.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, milk, eggs, breads, and noodles to sell in her store

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 28 years old, single, and he lives with parents. One of them works.

Safaa is a barber. He opened his own shop in 2010, where he offers shaving and massage services. He has sufficient experience in this field and has a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting $1800 loan to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Srey Pov

texts.en:
Srey Pov, 36, is married and resides with her mother, her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling sweet cake for more than two years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband is employed in the provincial department of health. He earns about USD 3 per day. Her children are still in her care and in school. 

Srey Pov wants to run an additional business in order to improve her family’s livelihood. Due to lack of funds, Srey Pov is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase clothes to resell. By doing so, she would earn extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to resell

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 33 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Vivian has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal and rice retailing.

Vivian aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines.

Melinda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy stock of groceries to sell in her store. She has been in this business for 7 years.

In the future, Melinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock and sell in her store.

loans.name: Suzana

texts.en: Suzana is 38 years old. She sells skirts and she has been doing business for the past 7 years. With the loan she wants to buy more skirts to sell and support the family from the profits that will be obtained from the business.

loans.use: To buy more skirts to sell.

loans.name: Angela Patricia

texts.es:
En el barrio Umiña de la ciudad de  Manta cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Umiña, ciudad conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y  por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Angela, tiene 48 años de edad, está separada pero de esta relación tuvo tres hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad,  dos de ellos aun vive con ella.
 
Ella es una gran madre  que para obtener sus propios recursos  para que no les faltara nada a sus hijos en sus estudios y en su hogar,  se dedica a la venta de zapatos, sandalias y ropa de todo tipo. Ella vende en su casa donde tiene  un pequeño local y hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan alguna prenda o zapatos, trabaja todos los días y dice que no se le dificulta ya que vende en su casa, a ella le traen su mercadería desde los Estados Unidos. Tiene más de 14 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
	
Este crédito es para comprar zapatos, sandalias y ropa interior de todo tipo. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal, es la secretaria del grupo y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten solucionar muchos problemas económicos en su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
In the Umiña neighborhood of the city of Manta the Umiña communal bank meets every two weeks. This city is known for its beautiful beaches, its cuisine and for being one of the most important ports in the country and in the Americas on the Pacific Ocean. 
 
Here we meet Angela. She is 48 years old and separated. She has three children who are grown. Two of them live with her. 
 
She is a great mother who in order to have her own resources so her children will lack nothing in their education and at home, sells shoes, sandals and all types of clothing.  She sells at her house where she has a small locale where her customers go when they need some article of clothing or shoes. She works every day and says that it isn't hard since she sells from her house. Her merchandise is brought to her from the United States. She has been doing this for more than 14 years and it is going very well. 
	
This loan is to buy shoes, sandals and all types of underwear. She has been in the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because the loans allow her to solve a lot of financial problems in her home.  
 
Her dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: to buy shoes, sandals and underwear.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha, 31, is married with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past five years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Asha dreams of expanding her business and employing more people in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase two sewing machines. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sewing machines.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena works hard to support her family. She is single and has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines.

Lorena requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, snack foods and other groceries.

She has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Lorena would like to save enough money to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, snack food and other groceries.

loans.name: Walda

texts.en:
As a married parent of 5 children, Walda works hard to support her family.

She has a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling phone accessories. Walda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell.

Walda has been sustaining her business activities throughout her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie works hard to support 7 children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Virgie requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy an ENVIROFIT COOKSTOVE.

She is getting the envirofit cookstove because she wants to save money by using the dried wood she can pick up from her surroundings.

Virgie is aware that by using the envirofit cookstove, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase an Envirofit cook stove

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai, 57, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than twenty years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband is a carpenter who earns about USD 3 per day. Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Mai is requesting a loan of USD 625 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase will help her reduce her transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her house to make it more comfortable for her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en: Rosette, aged 47, is a mother of four children aged between 20 and 15. All the children go to school. She owns a retail business selling rice, sugar, and soap. She has been in the business for five years. She needs the loan to add more rice, sugar and soap to her retail business inventory. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida is 63 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Lida has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, eggs, spices, etc. 

In the future Lida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 47 years old and married with 4 children.  With one child in school, Lucila works very hard to provide for them.

Lucila runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy stocks of groceries to sell in her store.

Lucila has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, noodles, and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future Lucila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Renilda

texts.en:
Renilda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving business.

She has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Renilda would like to save enough to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her abaca (local plant fiber) weaving business.

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es:
En el barrio Umiña de la ciudad de  Manta cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Umiña, ciudad conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y  por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Gloria, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  17 y 14 años de edad, ambos  estudian en colegio. Su esposo es chofer.

Ella con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos y con esto ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar hace mas de 10 años puso un pequeño bazar en su casa, allí vende de ropa de todo tipo, artículos de bazar, papelería, joyas de Romanel y productos de Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), entre otras cosas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 19h00, hay días que ella también sale a ofrecer sus productos y a cobrar ya que también deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar joyas, ropa,  perfumes, bisutería, útiles escolares entre otras cosas. Lleva más de 2 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son a muy bajos intereses.
 
Sus sueños seguir aumentando su negocio y que sus hijos sean muy buenos profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en:
In the Umiña neighborhood in the city of Manta the Umiña communal bank meets every two weeks. This city is known for its beautiful beaches, its cuisine and for being one of the most important ports of the country and of the Americas on the Pacific Ocean.  
 
Here we meet Gloria. She is 43 years old, married and the mother of two children, aged 17 and 14. They both are in high school. Her husband is a driver. 

In order to have her own income and help her husband with the household expenses, she opened a small variety store in her house 10 years ago. She sells a various items such as all types of clothes, paper products, Romanel jewelry and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories), among others. She works very day from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.. Some days she goes out to offer her products and to collect. She also sells on credit and collects every two weeks. 
 
This loan will be used to buy jewelry, clothes, perfume, school supplies and more. She has spent more than 2 years in the communal bank and she likes it because the loans have very low interest.
 
Her dream is to keep growing her business and for her children to be have good professional careers in the future.

loans.use: to buy jewelry, clothes, perfume, school supplies, etc.

loans.name: Regina Italia

texts.es:
En el barrio Umiña de la ciudad de  Manta cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Umiña, ciudad conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y  por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Regina, tiene 57 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda pero de esa relación tiene tres hijos todos mayores de edad,  el menor de ellos aun vive con ella. Ella lleva dos años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque le han brindado mucho apoyo dentro del grupo cuando más lo necesitaba.

Ella es maestra de un colegio de la localidad, profesión que le ha ayudado en gran parte para salir adelante y que se complementa con otra actividad que realiza nuestra amiga que es el comercio, vende ropa interior de damas, productos de plástico y  productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas).  Trabaja todos los días ya que en las tardes recorre por la localidad y también vende en el colegio donde imparte sus conocimientos, allí les vende a sus compañeras y a madres de familia que llegan hasta el lugar. Tiene 18 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, productos de plástico y ropa interior. 

Sus sueños son tener un almacén y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
In the Umiña neighborhood in the city of Manta, the Umiña communal bank meets every two weeks. This city is known for its beautiful beaches, its cuisine and for being one of the most important ports in the country and in the Americas on the Pacific Ocean. 
 
Here we meet Regina. She is 57 years old. Several years ago, her husband died and she became a widow. She has 3 grown children. The youngest still lives with her. She has been in the communal bank for two years and she likes it because it has offered her a lot of support within the group when she needed it the most.

She teaches in the local high school. This job has really helped her get ahead and she also does another activity as a merchant. She sells women's underwear, plastic products and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories). She works every day. Afternoons she sells in the area and she also sells at the school to her co-workers and the students' mothers who come in. She has been doing this activity for 18 years and it is going well.

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, plastic products and underwear.  

Her dream is to have a store and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cosmetics, plastic products and underwear.

loans.name: Agustín Alberto

texts.es:
En el barrio Umiña de la ciudad de  Manta cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Umiña, ciudad conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y  por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico.
 
En este lugar conocimos al Señor Agustín, tiene 54 años de edad, está separado pero de esa relación  tienen cuatro hijos, tres de ellos ya son mayores de edad, el menor es discapacitado, tiene 14 años de edad y estudian en una escuela para niños especiales.

Él es chofer de profesión y además de realizar fletes en su carro él también se dedica al comercio, compra y venta de chatarra y material reciclable, nos cuenta que él todos los días recorre la ciudad comprando a los recicladores todos sus productos para luego en las tardes cuando ya tenga una gran cantidad llevarlos a entregar a los centros donde compran estos materiales para volverlos a procesar. Lleva más de 5 años dedicado a esta actividad y nos cuenta que le deja muy buenos ingresos diarios. 

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar todo tipo de material reciclable. Lleva más de 2 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es comprar otro carro ya que el que tiene esta bastante deteriorado.
texts.en:
The Umiña communal bank meets every two weeks in the Umina neighborhood in the city of Manta.  The city is known for its beautiful beaches, its food,  and for having one of the most important ports in the country and in the Americas, located on the shores of the Pacific Ocean. 

This is where we meet Agustín, age 54.  He is separated, but they have four children from this relationship.  Three of the children are adults, and the youngest is disabled.  He is 14 years old, and he goes to school for special needs children.

He is a driver by profession.  In addition to transporting freight in his car, he buys and sells junk and recyclable material.  He tells us that every day he travels the city buying all kinds of recyclables.  In the afternoons, when he has a large amount, he takes them to the centers where they buy these materials to reprocess them.  He has been doing this for over five years, and he tells us that it gives him very good daily income.

He will use this loan to buy all types of recyclable materials.  He has been in the communal bank for over two years.  He likes it for the help that they give through the loans.

His dream is to buy another car because the one he has is really falling apart.

loans.use: to buy recyclable material.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a business-oriented person. She is 42 years old, married and has three children. All attend school and need a daily allowance. Marilyn has been selling fish and seafood for almost 10 years. She is very happy generating income from her business. 

She aspires to alleviate her family's living condition. To achieve this, she needs to increase her sales and income. In this regard, Marilyn is now borrowing a loan of P15,000 to be used as additional capital in buying more crabs, salmon, milk fish and shrimp to sell. 

In the future, Marilyn hopes to make the business more profitable to earn the funds for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more crabs, salmon, milk fish and shrimp to sell.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is 49 years old and married. She has four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Adelina is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Adelina has been raising pigs for six years and also earns additional income from basket weaving.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Fidelin

texts.en:
Fidelin is 30 years old and married. She has two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Fidelin is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy feed and additional piglets.

Fidelin has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from basket weaving.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional piglets.

loans.name: Sarita Katerine

texts.es:
Sarita  es una mujer de 23 años de edad estado civil conviviente, con 01 hijo a su cargo. Vive  en casa  propia  con su cónyuge. La casa está ubicada en el  caserío Huaca Blanca distrito de Tambogrande y cuenta con servicio de luz, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña de aproximadamente 100 familias.
La actividad que desarrolla Sarita es la crianza y venta  de  animales menores (caprinos, porcino, caprinos y aves de corral), los cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso exacto los comercializa en el mercado local. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 04 años aproximadamente, el negocio esta ubicado en la parte exterior de su domicilio y aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, así mismo su esposo es agricultor con parcela propia en la que tiene sembrado cultivo de mango, limón  en producción; es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro, lo que le permite tener ingresos adicionales.
El monto del crédito solicitado   es de 1000 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán para invertir en la  compra de alimento balanceado para engorde   y realizar mejoras de sus corrales, lo cual le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Sarita is a 23 year old woman in live in relationship.  She has a son whom she cares for and lives in a home of her own along with her husband.  Their home is located in the Huaca Blanca settlement within the Tambogrande district and has electricity.  It’s a small community of approximately 100 families.

Sarita raises and sells small animals (goats, pigs, and coral birds) which she sells in the local market after they reach the right size.  She’s been doing this for about four years.  Her business is located outside her home and she learned this from her parents.  Her husband is a farmer with his own parcel of land where he raises mangos and lemons.  He knows the field very well and this allows him to earn additional income.  She will use the money from this loan of 1,000 PEN to buy balanced feed so she can improve her corals and her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy feed and fix up her pens.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.

Virginia requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like pants, blouses and other clothing.

She has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like pants, blouses and other clothing.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines.

Wilma requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like soft-drinks, groceries etc,. to sell in her sari-sari store.

She has been in this business for 9 years.

In the future, Wilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soft-drinks, groceries etc., to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 38 years old, married and has five children.

Mohamad has owned a cattle farm since 2004 and sells dairy products. He has gained good experience in this field. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $3000 loan in order to buy a Friesian cow. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy a Friesian cow.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie is married and has six children; five are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Connie is 38 years old.

Connie has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. (Abaca is the fiber of a palm plant.) Connie has been in this business for 20 years.

Connie requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving.

In the future, Connie would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: Josiane

texts.en:
Josiane is single. She is 34 years old. She takes care of two children of her relative. 

She sells vegetables such as carrots, eggplants and tomatoes. She has spent six years in the business. 

With the loan she wants to add more carrots and tomatoes to sell. She wants to build a house from the profits that she will get from the business.

loans.use: To buy more carrots, eggplants and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is 61 years old and married. She has two children.

Carmencita runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. Carmencita has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, detergent, canned goods and other groceries. 

She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

In the future Carmencita would like to save money to expand the business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is divorced with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a food stall business, selling to passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing goods in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase more food for her food stall. She decided to join Yehu to access loans for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more food for her food stall.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 43 years old and married. She has four children and two are in school, Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar and soap.

She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

In the future Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose tiene 32 años de edad, junto a su pareja tiene 3 maravillosos hijos los cuales son su alegría de vivir y cuyas edades comprenden 9,6 y 7 meses; su vivienda se ubica en el distrito de Santiago, el distrito de Santiago se caracteriza por albergar a varias empresas agroexportadoras las cuales brindan muchos puestos de trabajo, se practica la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, esparrago y uva. Cuando tiene un tiempo libre le gusta ir al campo ya que posee una pequeña parcela en la que cultiva diversos productos que también vende cuando hay época de cosecha, asimismo le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con pollo con papa a la huancaína”, es buenísimo por el comería este platillo todos los días. El solo tuvo estudios secundarios pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Mecánica Automotriz ya que le agrada arreglar carros.

Día a día Jose sale a trabaja con mucho entusiasmo en su negocio como chofer de taxi, él le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes de manera diaria, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable y sobre todo educado con los clientes.

Jose está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá iniciar los trámites para comprar un auto de segunda mano; lo que le permitirá ya no tener que alquilar el vehículo para trabajar sino tener el propio; así el podrá seguir trabajando día a día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Construir un segundo piso en su casa”.
texts.en:
Jose is 32 years old and he and his wife have three wonderful children, ages 9 and 6 years and 7 months.  They are the loves of their lives.  Their home is located in the Santiago district, characterized for hosting various export farming companies that provide many jobs and raise cotton, asparagus, and grapes.  When he has some free time he likes to go to the country where he has a small parcel where he raises various products which he sells during the harvest season.  He also enjoys eating one of his favorite dishes, chicken and rice with huancaina potatoes.  It’s delicious and he could eat this dish every day.  He only has a junior high school education but he would have liked to study auto repair since he fixes cars.
 

Jose goes out to work enthusiastically as a taxi driver each day.  He works around 10 hours a day and can serve up to 20 customers daily.  He believes that he’s doing well in his business because he’s friendly and courteous with his customers. 
 

Jose is very grateful for the Kiva loans and thanks to the help he’s received, he can begin working on buying a second hand car, which will allow him to realize his greatest goal, “To add a second story to his home.”

loans.use: to buy a second hand car

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma 40, is married and lives at a family house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past seven years, she has operated a food stall business, selling as retail to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of purchasing goods. She dreams of expanding her business and opening another food stall in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase 2 sacks of rice, sugar, and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of rice, sugar, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Aloys

texts.en:
Aloys is 38 years old. He sells shirts and has been in the business for 10 years. 

He wants the loan to buy more shirts to sell and make a huge store for his shirts. 

With the profits, he will reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more shirts to sell.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Felipa works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Felipa has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF.

Felipa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell for her fish-vending business.
 
She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed, 63, is a married man with two children, both of whom attend school. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past ten years, he has owned rental houses. His potential customers are tenants from the nearby town. He faces a major challenge of delayed payments by tenants.

With the requested loan, Mohamed wants to renovate his rental house and purchase cement and colored paint. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to renovate his rental house and purchase cement and colored paint.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita, 43, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is a mother who is married to Jose, her business partner. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Teresita operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during the evenings, when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a typical family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food to feed one or two people when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw ingredients. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 
 
Teresita dreams of giving her all of her children a good, high-quality education through her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have her own restaurant. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Helene

texts.en: Helene is a mother of four children. She is 34 years old and is married to a driver. She has been selling honey and butter for the last six years. With the requested loan, she will buy more honey and butter to sell. She dreams of expanding her business from the profits she will earn. She wants to see her business prosper in the future.

loans.use: To buy more honey and butter to sell.

loans.name: Sann

texts.en:
Sann is a 23-year-old married woman who lives with her mother and one sister in a house in Pouk province. She doesn’t have any children yet but she wishes to have one soon. She makes bamboo baskets to help her husband generate income for the family, earning approximately USD 3.50 per day. There are frequent customers who come into the village to collect and buy bamboo baskets from local people weekly. Therefore, she has no worries about her market. 

Sann would like to take out a loan of KHR 2,000,000 to build a room where she can store her bamboo baskets. She feels happy that she will have a good place to keep her finished products for her customers. In the future, she hopes that she will be able to increase her productivity and household income.

loans.use: to build a room where she can store her bamboo baskets.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 40 years old, married, and has five children.

Amer has owned a store since 1990, selling spare parts for cars. He has more than twenty years' experience in this field and a deep understanding of local customers and their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He has applied for a $1200 loan in order to install a sliding door for his store. He aims to gain more profits in order to provide a better life for his whole family.

loans.use: to install a sliding door for his store.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en: Jean Claude is 23 years old. He is single. He has been selling trousers and shirts for seven years. With the requested loan, he wants to buy more shirts and trousers to sell. He will use the profits from the business to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more trousers and shirts to sell.

loans.name: Mwatime

texts.en:
Mwatime, 37, is married with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are medical bills and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a food stall, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other food stall operators. She dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future.

With the requested loan of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking fat/oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking fat/oil.

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es:
Mauricio es  un agricultor  muy joven de apenas 23 años de edad , padre de familia , vive en la zona sur del país, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas en la provincia de Puntarenas. La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.

Mauricio está solicitando un préstamo de ₡600.000 (seiscientos mil colones), para la compra de semilla de maíz y de frijol , abono granular y fungicidas para proteger sus cultivos durante el desarrollo y evitar también que aparezcan hongos en sus plantaciones, El vende la cosecha en una asociación de la localidad y con esto mantiene a su familia y hace frente a otras obligaciones económicas, desea llegar a ser un productor grande y prosperar y tener mayores ingresos y comodidades para él y su familia y para ello hace el mayor esfuerzo en esta actividad agrícola .

Para Mauricio este es su primer préstamo como  socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal denla Danta S.A, una de las 150 empresas de crédito comunal de Costa Rica. para lograrlo .
texts.en: Mauricio is a very young farmer, barely 23 years old. He is a father and lives in the southern part of the country, in Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas province. Local economy revolves around agricultural activities, principally tubers, coffee, corn, black beans and animal husbandry. Mauricio asks for a loan of ₡600,000 (six hundred thousand colones) to buy corn and bean seeds, pellet fertilizer and fungicides to protect his crops while they grow and prevent fungi from attacking them. He sells his harvest to a local association and uses this income to support his family and face other economic obligations. He wishes to become a bigger producer and to prosper, to earn more money and give his family more amenities. With this goal in mid, he strives with all his might at his agricultural activity. This is Mauricio's first loan as a member of Empresa de Crédito Comunal denla Danta S.A, one of the 150 communal banks that exist in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu, 39, is married with three adult children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and medical bills.

For the past two years, she has operated a coconut selling business, supplying neighboring countries. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuations in the market. She aspires to expand the business and hire more people in the future.

With the requested loan of KES 10,000, she wants to purchase 2000 coconuts.

loans.use: to purchase 2000 coconuts.

loans.name: Maram

texts.en:
Maram is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Shafeeq appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Maram is a 25-year-old woman. She is married to Shafeeq who works in a local marble factory and earns a low salary, which is not enough to cover all of the family's costs.
