Maram is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing new living room furniture. This will provide Maram and her family with suitable and comfortable living room furniture.

loans.use: To purchase new living room furniture.

loans.name: Diogene

texts.en: Diogene is 28 years old. He sells different kinds of clothes. He has requested a loan to add more shirts, trousers, and skirts to his inventory. He has been in this business for the past five years. He is working hard to save money to buy a house in the future.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Leyla Vanessa

texts.es:
Leyla es una joven muy humilde y sobre todo luchadora, vive junto a su madre a la cual apoya mucho con el fruto de su trabajo, ya que debido al terremoto del año 2007 su casa se derrumbo y desde ese entonces vive en un modulo; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que fue devastada en el año 2007 por el terremoto de ese mismo año en el cual perecieron muchas personas y dejo mucha tristeza entre los pobladores; es conocida también porque en ella se encuentran las Islas Ballestas, las cuales reciben infinidad de turistas en todo el año y también porque se realiza la pesca y la agricultura. Con mucho esfuerzo Leyla logro iniciar su negocio de venta de carne de pollo pero no le fue muy bien así que decidió iniciar su negocio de venta de ropa con la poca ganancia que obtuvo del negocio anterior, tal fue su empeño que ya lleva 2 años trabajando en la venta de ropa y le va bien, ella cree que esta mejora se ha dado porque atiende a los clientes con amabilidad y siempre ofrece productos de calidad a bajo precio.

Leyla está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio como pantalones, polos, blusas, poleras zapatillas entre otros con los cual podrá tener mayor variedad de productos y mejorara sus ingresos, así ella seguirá luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un negocio más grande”.
texts.en:
Leyla is a respectful and above all hardworking young woman.  She lives with her mother, whom she helps a lot with the fruit of her labor. Thanks to the 2007 earthquake, their house fell down, and since then, they have lived in a trailer.  Their home is located in Pisco, a city that was devastated by the earthquake in 2007; many people died, and the inhabitants suffered greatly.  Pisco is well-known because the Ballestas Islands are located there, and many tourists visit and also because of the area's fishing and farming.  With great effort, Leyla started a business selling chicken meat, but as it did not go very well, she decided to launch her clothing business with the small amount of money she had made from her previous business. Such is her determination that she has spent two years selling clothing, and it is going well.  She thinks that this improvement is because she is always friendly to her clients and always offers them high-quality products at a low price.

Leyla is very grateful to Kiva members, as thanks to your help, she can now buy more merchandise for her business, such as pants, polo shirts, shirts, t-shirts, sandals, etc.  This will allow her to offer a greater variety of products and thus improve her income.  This is how she works every day to make her greatest dream a reality:  "To have a bigger business."

loans.use: to buy merchandise (pants, polo shirts, shirts, t-shirts, sandals, etc.)

loans.name: Karina Tamara

texts.es:
En el barrio Umiña de la ciudad de  Manta cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Umiña, ciudad conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y  por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Karina, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada hace varios años pero no ha tenido hijos. Su esposo es médico. Está desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y a muy bajos intereses.
 
Ella es odontóloga y tiene un consultorio en su casa, allí recibe a  muchos pacientes que llegan a realizarse chequeos o curaciones en sus piezas dentales, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00, ya son 15 años que lleva ejerciendo su profesión y  gracias a Dios siempre le ha ido muy bien, ella esta solicitando el crédito para arreglar su consultorio, con el dinero del crédito va a comprar cerámicas para un baño que recientemente construyó para sus pacientes y un sofá para la salita de espera, esto con la finalidad de brindar un servicio más cómodo para que los pacientes aumenten.

Sus metas son seguir adelante tanto en el banco como en su vida profesional y familiar.
texts.en: In the Umiña neighbourhood of the city of Manta, every other week, the Umiña communal bank meets. The city is known for its beautiful beaches, its cuisine and for being one of the more important Pacific ports of the country as well as the American continent. This is where we met Karina; she is 40 years old, has been married for a long time but does not have children. Her husband is a physician. She is a member of the communal bank since its inception, and she likes it because loans are quick and very low-interest. She is an odontologist and her surgery is set up at her house, where she attends to many patients, who come for check-ups or alterations to their dental work. She works every day from 8 am to 6 pm and has been in this profession for 15 years, and thankfully she has always done very well. She asks for this loan in order to refurbish her surgery: with the money, she intends to buy a washbasin for the recently-built bathroom for her patients' use as well as a sofa for the small waiting room, both in order to make the premises more comfortable so as to attract more patients. Her goals are to carry on both with the bank and with improving her professional life and her family life.

loans.use: to buy a washbasin and a sofa.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for more Sakura noodles and Pampers to sell

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is 32 and single. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
For the past two years, he has operated a farming business, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of establishing a dairy farm in the future.
With the KES 20000 loan, he wants to purchase a cow for his dairy farm. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for his dairy farm.

loans.name: Hamadi

texts.en:
Hamadi, 30, is single and lives in a family house that has electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.
For the past two years, he has operated a retail shop, selling household goods to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of competition from other retail shop operators. He dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.
With the KES 20000 he wants to purchase sacks of beans, sugar, and rice. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, sugar, and rice.

loans.name: Milagros Ernestina

texts.es:
Milagros es una joven muy humilde y sobre todo luchadora, tiene 32 años de edad y vive junto a su madre a la cual apoya mucho con el fruto de su trabajo, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que fue devastada en el año 2007 por el terremoto de ese mismo año en el cual perecieron muchas personas y dejo mucha tristeza entre los pobladores; es conocida también porque en ella se encuentran las Islas Ballestas, las cuales reciben infinidad de turistas en todo el año y también porque se realiza la pesca y la agricultura. Con mucho esfuerzo Milagros logro iniciar su negocio de de venta de ropa ya lleva 4 años trabajando en la venta de ropa y le va bien, ella cree que esta mejora se ha dado porque atiende a los clientes con amabilidad y siempre ofrece productos de calidad a bajo precio.

Milagros está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar más mercadería para su negocio como pantalones, polos, blusas, ropa para niños entre otros con lo cual podrá tener mayor variedad de productos y mejorara sus ingresos, así ella seguirá luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus padres”.
texts.en:
Milagros is a very humble and, above all, tenacious young woman.  She is 32 years old, and she lives with her mother.  She supports her a lot with the fruit of her labor.  Her home is located in the city of Pisco.  

This city was devastated in 2007 by the earthquake that year.  Many people perished and left great sadness among the people who survived.  The city is also known because of the Islas Ballestas, which receive an infinity of tourists throughout the whole year.  It is also known for its fishing and agriculture.

With great effort Milagros managed to start her business of selling clothes.  She has been selling clothes for four years, and it is going well for her.  She believes that this improvement took place because of the friendly way she waits on her customers.  She always offers quality products at a low price.

Milagros is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help they have given her she will be able to buy more merchandise for her business.  She will buy things like pants, polo style shirts, blouses, and children’s clothes, among others.   By doing so she will be able to have a greater variety of products and improve her income.  This way she will continue her efforts every day to make her biggest dream come true:  To give her parents a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like pants, polo style shirts, blouses, and children’s clothes, among others.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 42 years old business lady. She is a widow, a mother of one child.  She has been selling car tires for the past 10 years with a monthly income of KES 55,000 which she uses to support her child. The client is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD .  


Rose will use the loan to add more tires for sale. With the anticipated profit from the business she intends to educate her child and open another tire shop. Her hopes and dreams are to be a major supplier of tires in Embu Town in the central part of Kenya, and to give her child a quality education.

loans.use: to add more tires for sale

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 25-year-old young man who is engaged and prepared to get married.  He is employed and gets a low salary which is not enough to cover all his wedding expenses.

Ahmad is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help cover the costs of purchasing new bedroom furniture and living room seats. Taking this loan will enable Ahmad to prepare well for his wedding and provide his future wife with furniture suitable for comfortable home conditions.
Ahmad is appear in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase new bedroom furniture and living room seats.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is a forty five year old man who is married with three children. He has a dressmaking business in Kariobangi North. He has been in the business for eight years now. He gets a monthly income of twenty four thousand shillings.

This will be Stanley's first loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy more material. With the profits, he plans to expand his business. In future he wants to have his own dressmaking college.

loans.use: to buy more material for dressmaking

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose  is a forty five year old married lady with four children who go to school. She is a vendor of shoes in Kariobangi North and has been in the business for four years now. She gets a monthly income of twenty five thousand shillings. 

This will be Rose's first loan with KADET LTD.  She plans to use the entire loan to buy more shoes. In the future Rose wants her family to do well and she wants to prosper in the business.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for sale.

loans.name: Genny Cruz María

texts.es:
En el barrio Umiña de la ciudad de  Manta cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Umiña, ciudad conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y  por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico. 

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Genny, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  27 y 25 años  de edad,  la mayor aun vive con ella ya que está separada de su esposo. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella para  ganar algo por su cuenta  hace tres años atrás con los ahorros que tenia adecuo un local en su casa en el cual vende queso y pescado por libras, allí trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 18h00 y a veces hasta más tarde ya que como es en su casa no le incomoda atender a sus clientes a cualquier hora, nos cuenta que ella sale a las playas a comprar directamente a los pescadores ya que así compra el mejor pescado y a muy buen precio, en cuanto al queso le llevan a entregar directamente de Chone.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pescado y quesos para la venta. Lleva más de 5 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que les ha dado la institución.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante en su negocio ya que allí se siente bien.
texts.en:
In the city of Manta’s Umiña neighborhood the Umiña communal bank meets every fifteen days; it’s a city known for its beautiful beaches, its cuisine and for being one of the country’s and America’s most important ports located on the shores of the Pacific.

We met Genny, 50, here.  She’s married and has two children who are 27 and 25 years old.  The oldest still lives with her because she’s separated from her husband.  Genny's husband’s a merchant.

To earn money on her own, three years ago she used the savings she had to set up a space at home to sell cheese and fish by the pound.  She works there every day from 6am until 6pm and sometimes even later since it’s no inconvenience for her to tend to customers at home at any hour.  She tells us that she goes out to the beaches to buy directly from fishermen because she buys the best fish at very good prices that way.   As for the cheese, it’s delivered to her directly from Chone.

She will use this loan to buy fish and cheese to sell.  She’s been in the communal bank for more than five years and she likes it because of the benefits she gets from the institution.  Her dream is to stay in business because she feels good in it.

loans.use: to buy fish and cheese.

loans.name: Maryuri Maribel

texts.es:
En el barrio Umiña de la ciudad de  Manta cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Umiña, ciudad conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y  por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Maryuri, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 10, 8 años y  un bebé de seis meses, los  dos mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.

Ella para salir adelante junto a su familia, tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa,  allí vende todo tipo de productos como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  también realiza recargas telefónicas, con lo cual se gana algo extra, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos y su esposo le ayudan en su trabajo cuando ellos pueden y están desocupados, nos cuenta que le gusta su trabajo ya que así se gana algo y siempre está atenta a las necesidades de sus hijos ya que no tiene que salir de su casa. Tiene 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 5 años y le gusta porque con el primer crédito que recibió empezó su negocio.
 
Su meta es seguir adelante en su negocio y que crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
In the city of Manta’s Umiña neighborhood the Umiña communal bank meets every fifteen days; it’s a city known for its beautiful beaches, its cuisine and for being one of the country’s and America’s most important ports located on the shores of the Pacific.

We met Maryuri, 36, in this place.  She’s married and has three children who are 10 and 8 years old and a six month old baby.  The two oldest attend school.  Her husband works in a factory in Manta.

In order to get ahead with her family, she has a grocery store at home; she sells all types of products like rice, sugar, oil, detergent, vegetables, greens and fruit.  She also sells mobile phone recharges which produce a little extra income for her.  She works every day from 6am until 8pm and sometimes even later.  Her children and her husband help her with the work when they can and aren’t busy.  She tells us that she likes her work because she earns a bit and can be watchful of her children at the same time since she doesn’t have to leave the house.  She’s been in this line of work for five years and does very well.

She will use this loan to better stock her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, cured meats and other basic staple items.  She’s been in the communal bank for five years and likes it because she was able to start her business with the first loan she got.  Her goal is to stay in business and that it grows more every day.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Kean

texts.en:
Kean is just 28 years old. She is a married woman who is responsible for two school-aged children and who lives in Kompong Cham province. She is a local rice farmer who has been involved in this type of business for more than 7 years. She usually works in this project along with her spouse. Most of her income is not really enough for her expenses, as all of it goes to sustain her family.
Kean is asking for a loan from HKL and Kiva to pay for the land fees and buy bean seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides to ensure a fruitful harvest in the coming season. This loan will enable her to sustain her business as well as her living condition. For her business goal, Kean wants to buy extra land to expand her productivity and to improve the standard of living for her family, especially her children who still need her daily allowances.

loans.use: to pay for the land fees and buy bean seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides to ensure a fruitful harvest in the coming season.

loans.name: Jorge Alfredo

texts.es:
Jorge es un joven de 29 años de edad, junto a su esposa tiene un pequeño niño de 3 años de edad el cual es su adoración y por el cual trabaja con mucho esmero para darle lo necesario y una vida feliz; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que fue devastada en el año 2007 por el terremoto de ese mismo año en el cual perecieron muchas personas y dejo mucha tristeza entre los pobladores; es conocida también porque en ella se encuentran las Islas Ballestas, las cuales reciben infinidad de turistas en todo el año y también porque se realiza la pesca y la agricultura. Jorge anteriormente trabaja como chofer de mototaxi en vehículos alquilados pero con el apoyo de sus suegros y unos ahorros que tenia pudo adquirir su propia mototaxi, por ello el trabaja diariamente alrededor de 10 horas y puede atender hasta 20 clientes en el día; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y dedicado y también porque es muy conocido y ya lleva trabajando en este negocio 7 años.

Jorge está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ay que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar llantas nuevas para su vehículo y realizar un mantenimiento al motor de su vehículo; lo que le permitirá tener un vehículo en buen estado y seguro para el transporte de los clientes, así el seguirá trabajando y podrá seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación y calidad de vida a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Jorge, 29, is a young man living with his wife and he has a little three year old boy who is his adoration and for whom he works very hard to give him everything necessary and a happy life.  His house is in the city of Pisco, a city that was devastated in 2007 by the earthquake of that same year in which many people perished and much sorrow was left behind among the residents.  It’s also well known because the Ballestas Islands are there which are visited by infinity of tourists all year and also because of its fishing and agriculture.

Jorge used to work as a mototaxi driver in leased vehicles but with support from his in-laws and with some savings he had he was able to buy his own mototaxi.  He works about 10 hours daily and can take care of up to 20 customers daily.  He believes that he does well in his business because he’s very responsible and dedicated and also because he’s well known and has been in business seven years.

Jorge is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given him he will be able to buy new tires for the vehicle and to service the engine which will allow him to have a safe vehicle in good operating conditions to continue to offer passenger transportation services to be able to make his greatest dream a reality:  to give a good education and quality of life to his son.

loans.use: to buy tires and service his vehicle.

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdalla, 73, is married with six children, all of whom graduated from school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
For the past four years, he has operated a farming business, selling farm produce at the market to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his place of operation. Abdalla dreams of expanding his business to meet a larger market demand. 
With the KES 50000 he wants to purchase farm produce and fertilizers. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase farm produce and fertilizers.

loans.name: Delia Mariza

texts.es:
Delia es una joven de 27 años de edad, vive al lado de su esposo con el cual tiene una pequeña hija de 2 años de edad y junto a su pareja la aman y quieren mucho y ambos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante y sobre todo darle mucho amor; su vivienda de Delia se ubica en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que fue devastada en el año 2007 por el terremoto de ese mismo año en el cual perecieron muchas personas y dejo mucha tristeza entre los pobladores; es conocida también porque en ella se encuentran las Islas Ballestas, las cuales reciben infinidad de turistas en todo el año y también porque se realiza la pesca y la agricultura. Delia es muy luchadora y sobre todo entusiasta y por ello decidió apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y logro iniciar su negocio de venta de abarrotes desde hace ya 10 años, fue un poco difícil al principio pero a la vez gratificante ya que gracias a ello puede apoyar a su esposo y darle cada día una mejor calidad de vida a su pequeña de acuerdo a sus posibilidades; ella se dedica alrededor de 10 horas en su negocio y puede atender hasta 15 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien porque es amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque su ánimo de salir adelante y su hija son su mejor motivación.

Delia está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio en especial bebidas gaseosas, menestras, atún leche en lata, azúcar, fideos, entre otros; con esta mejora ella tendrá mayor variedad de productos para ofrecerá a sus clientes y mejora sus ingresos, con lo cual seguirá luchando día a día para salir adelante y luchar para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena calidad de vida a su familia y seguir apoyando a su esposo”.
texts.en:
Delia, 27, is a young woman living with her husband and their two year old little girl.  She and her husband love her very much and both strive daily to get ahead and above all to give her much love.  

Delia’s house is located in the city of Pisco which was devastated in 2007 by an earthquake that same year in which many people perished leaving behind much sorrow among the residents.  It’s also well known because the Ballestas Islands are located there which are visited by infinity of tourists all year and also because of the fishing and agriculture.

Delia is very tenacious and above all enthusiastic and this is why she decided to help out her husband with the household expenses.  She managed to start a grocery store ten years ago.  It was a bit difficult at first but at the same time very gratifying because thanks to it she was able to help her husband and within her possibilities provide her little girl with better quality of life every day.  She spends around 10 hours daily in her business and can take care of up to 15 customers per day.  She believes that she does well because she’s kind to all her customers and above all because of her will to get ahead; her daughter is her best motivation.

Delia is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to buy more merchandise for her store especially soft-drinks, vegetables, tuna, canned milk, sugar and noodles, among others.  With this improvement she’ll have a wider variety of goods to offer her customers and will improve her income with which she will continue striving day to day to get ahead and to make her greatest dream a reality:  to give her family a good quality of life and continue to help out her husband.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Irakli

texts.en:
Irakli is 30 years old. He comes from a small village of Vani District, West Georgia. Irakli is married and lives with his family, wife Larisa, two children (3 and 1 years old) and mother Natela. Larisa and Natela are housewives. Irakli is the only income provider in the family. He grows maize on a family owned plot of the land. Most of the harvest is used by the family and the small surplus is sold on the local market. The family also grows 100 nut trees selling the harvested nuts to local nut exporters. According to the local government’s estimations (designation), the family belongs to the 'vulnerable poor' category. They receive relevant social assistance. Total average monthly income of the family is 275 Laris, including social assistance. 

Irakli requested credit for the start-up of a trade business. He will purchase fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices and resell them on the local retail market.  His loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisions the provision of business start-up and re-startup credit with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Irakli will be able to purchase fruits and vegetables. For the first time, Irakli will reinvest the whole profit in the business in order to expand it. In the long run, the income of the family will increase and they will be able to improve their living conditions. Along with the above, the family, if needed, will have enough income to access regular credit products available on country’s capital market.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Luisa Melina

texts.es:
Luisa es una mujer muy trabajadora y sobre todo con mucha iniciativa, vive al lado de su esposo el cual es su mano derecha y la apoya en todo lo que emprende a pesar de que el trabaja como bodeguero en un empresa pesquera siempre se da un tiempo para apoyar a Luisa; junto a ella también vive su pequeña hija de 5 años de edad, es el mejor regalo que Dios le ha podido dar nos comenta y por ella daría la vida con tal de verla feliz; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que fue devastada en el año 2007 por el terremoto de ese mismo año en el cual perecieron muchas personas y dejo mucha tristeza entre los pobladores; es conocida también porque en ella se encuentran las Islas Ballestas, las cuales reciben infinidad de turistas en todo el año y también porque se realiza la pesca y la agricultura. Luisa anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de ropa, pero no le fue muy bien, ya que daba sus productos al crédito y lamentablemente no le pagaban y poco a poco iba perdiendo la poca ganancia que obtenía, pero tuvo la iniciativa y decidió tener un negocio de venta de abarrotes en el cual trabaja actualmente y tal es asi que ya lleva 3 años en este negocio; ella cree que le va bien porque atiende de manera amable y porque gracias a su negocio anterior gano experiencia y ahora sabe mucho mejor como manejar su negocio actual.

Luisa está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comparar mas mercadería para su negocio como arroz, azúcar fideos, menestras, golosinas, entre otros, con lo cual tendrá mayor variedad de productos y mejorar sus ingresos, así seguirá mejorando cada día y seguirá luchando por conseguir que su sueño se haga realidad, el cual es “ Crecer como microempresaria y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de Vida”.
texts.en:
Luisa is a very hardworking woman with much initiative.  She lives with her husband who is her right hand and supports everything she takes on; despite working as a warehouse man in a fishing firm he always finds time to support Luisa.  Her five year old little girl also lives with them.  She is the best gift God could have given her and she tells us that she’d give her life just to see her happy.

Her house is located in the city of Pisco, a city that was devastated by the 2007 earthquake in which many people perished leaving behind much sorrow among the residents.  It’s also well known because the Ballestas Islands are located there which receive large numbers of tourists all year round and also because of the fishing and agriculture there.

Luisa used to be a clothes merchant but didn’t do too well because she’d sell her items on credit and unfortunately she wouldn’t be paid back and gradually lost the profits she’d made.  But, she got the idea of opening a grocery store which is where she works now; she’s been in this business for three years now and she believes she does well in it because of the kind way she treats her customers and because she’d gained experience from her previous business and now she knows how to run her current business much better.

Luisa is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to buy merchandise for her store like rice, sugar, noodles, vegetables and snacks, among others which will allow her to have a wider variety of goods available and to improve her income to continue improving each day and striving to attain her greatest dream which is: to grow as a micro businesswoman and to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 29-year-old married lady with four children. She sells new clothes and has been in the business for nine years now. She gets a monthly income of 26000 shillings. 
This will be her first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy more clothes. In the future, she wants to have a good and prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Chhun is 34 years old and a resident of Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province, where she plants and grows crops like rice, potatoes and beans. She has been doing this for 12 years on her own farmland. From this type of business, she is able to make a suitable income of $5.00 per day. 

Presently she has three children attending local schools of the province and who need daily allowances from her. In order to increase the family's income, Chhun's husband wants to make a new business of providing tree-cutting services to local people. However, he doesn't have a chain saw for this type of business. 

To solve the problem and further improve the family's living conditions, Chhun decided to look for a loan to purchase a chain saw for her husband to start providing this service in exchange for money. In the future, Chhun wants to save her income for the family's emergencies and she hopes that she will be able to bring her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to purchase a chain saw for her husband to start a tree-cutting service

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia, 40, is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.
For the past four years, she has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of market competition in her business. Sofia dreams of establishing a charcoal depot in the future.
With the KES 20000, she wants to purchase 16 sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 16 sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Marie Josee

texts.en: Marie Josee is 32 years old. She is a photographer and has spent nine years in the business. With the loan she wants to buy a better camera that takes nice pictures to replace her old one. The profits from the business will be used to expand the business she does. She would like to see her business prosper in the future.

loans.use: To buy a camera for her photography business

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor es una señora de 49 años de edad  vive con  dos de sus hijos en la una  comunidad de la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas llamada La Danta. Aquí la economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.

 Ella siembra la tierra ,  produce frijol y maíz , conoce bien el oficio ya que desde muy joven realiza .
esta actividad,  muy común en la zona tanto  para hombres como para mujeres. Flor está solicitando un préstamo de ₡300.000 (trescientos mil colones), para darle mantenimiento a su siembra por medio de abono  de desarrollo y abono nutritivo,   esenciales para el buen desarrollo del producto   y fungicidas para  proteger sus cultivos durante todo el proceso   hasta la cosecha , de esta manera ofrecerá al consumidor un excelente producto  de muy  buena calidad.

Su objetivo es salir adelante económicamente , mejorar su casa y colaborar con los gastos económicos de su hogar.
Flor  es una socia más  que se ha  integrado a  la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de la Danta S.A, una de las 150 empresas de crédito comunal de Costa Rica y este es su primer préstamo
texts.en:
Flor is a 49 year old woman living with two of her children in a community in the south of Costa Rica located in Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas, called La Danta.  Local economy here is based on farming and raising livestock; growing tubers, coffee, corn, beans and raising cattle stand out.

She is a farmer; she produces beans and corn.  She knows the occupation well since she’s been doing it since she was very young.  This activity is very common for both men and women in this zone.

Flor is asking for a ₡300.000 (three-hundred thousand) colones loan to provide crop maintenance by purchasing manure and fertilizers essential for the good development of the crops and fungicide to protect the crops during the growing period all the way to harvest.  In this manner, she will offer the consumer an excellent product of very good quality.

Her goal is to get ahead economically, to make improvements to her house and to help meet all household expenses.

Flor is one more member of the La Danta S.A. communal bank, one of the 150 communal banks in Costa Rica; this is her first loan.

loans.use: to buy corn and bean seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Ivane

texts.en:
Ivane is 47 years old. He lives in a small village of the Kakheti, Akhmeta District. Ivane is married and lives with his wife Lia and mother (who is retired). Lia works as a teacher in a local kindergarten. The family has a small vineyard and he sells grapes in the fall. The total average monthly income of the family is 250 Laris. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Ivane requested credit for start up of a small village business. In particular, he will purchase a small truck. With the purchased truck Ivane will work on transportation. Mainly he will serve local companies for a certain fee. There are many small sawmills and stone-mills, which often need transportation of their products or raw materials. 

His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of low income. 

With the received credit Ivane will get an additional source of the income. Also, it is important that his transportation business won't be seasonal. The income of the family will increase and they will be able to improve their living conditions. Along with the abovementioned the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available in the country's capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase a truck for the transportation of goods

loans.name: Sofya

texts.en:
Sofya runs a trading business. She rents a shop where she sells food, household goods, and toys. Sofya buys merchandise for her business from suppliers. Sofya’s shop has a very varied assortment of goods, such as beverages, food, dairy and meat products, candy, soft toys, washing agents, and shampoos. Thanks to the diversity of her shop, she has many customers, and her shop is opened late. 
Sofya is 48 years old. She lives and runs her business in Yerevan. Sofya is married, and she has two adult children, a son and a daughter. Sofya’s husband works as a driver, and her son works as a storage worker at a book shop. Sofya’s daughter is married, and she lives separately from her parents. Sofya’s husband and son help her with her business, as it is the major part of their family’s income. Sofya is a teacher by training, but she has never worked as one. Instead, she worked as a shop assistant in a food shop many years ago, so she has good experience in this field. 
Sofya needs a $3000 loan to buy tinned goods, tea, coffee, spices, confectionary, and other goods for her newly opened shop.

loans.use: to buy tinned goods, tea, coffee, spices, confectionary, and other goods for her newly opened shop

loans.name: Myadagmaa

texts.en: Myadagmaa is a 43-year-old woman who lives with her two children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Darhan-uul Province, Mongolia. Her elder child is a college student and her younger one is a school-age student. Myadagmaa runs a lingerie retail business in a market. The business she runs is one of the few places in the market that sells lingerie; therefore, her business income is surprisingly good. However, due to her recent divorce, she lost a significant amount of money to her husband. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "It is a dark time for my family; however, nothing will stop me." She is requesting 1200000 MNT to buy lingerie from Erlian at a wholesale price.

loans.use: to buy lingerie from Erlian at a wholesale price.

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es:
Dionisio es un hombre de 43 años de edad y vive con su familia, en una comunidad de la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas. La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.

Dionisio está solicitando un préstamo de ₡1.000.000.00 (un millón de colones), para la compra de semilla de ñampí,  insecticidas y mano de obra, ya que requiere de ayuda en el proceso de la producción  y de mantenimiento por medio de abono y fungicidas para proteger el cultivo. Con el cuido preciso en el proceso de desarrollo  brindara productos de calidad a sus clientes, alcanzara la meta de venta que se ha propuesto. Y además dará a abasto con todas sus obligaciones y pagos para así sacar adelante a su familia.

Dionisio  es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal denla Danta S.A, una de las 150 empresas de crédito comunal de Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Dionisio is a 43-year-old man who lives with his family in a community in the southern zone of Costa Rica, located in Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas. The local economy is based on agriculture, mainly livestock and the harvesting of tubers, coffee, corn, and beans.
Dionisio is requesting a loan of ₡1,000,000 (one million colones) for the purchase of ñampí [a tuber] seeds and insecticides. He will also use the loan to pay labourers, as he needs help with production and maintenance (applying fertilizer and fungicides to protect the crops). Through his vigilant care of his developing crops, he will be able to offer quality products to his customers and reach his sales goal. Furthermore, he will be able to meet his obligations and payments in order to get his family ahead.
Dionisio is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal denla Danta S.A, one of the 150 community credit enterprises in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy ñampi seeds and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Asiya

texts.en: Asiya is 30 years old and has two children aged 6 and 10 years. She has been working as a tailor for six years. With the loan, she wants to buy fabrics from which she can make shirts, trousers, blouses, and skirt to sell in the market to get more earnings. She plans to use most of the profits for reinvestment in the business because she has seen that more consumers need her items.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics for making clothes for sale

loans.name: Josiane

texts.en: Josiane is 30 years old. She has been a tailor for the past 10 years. She wants the loan to buy more fabrics to make clothes. She will use the profits for her savings. She is proud of being a tailor and she wants to make changes in her life, if she gets the loan, for a better future.

loans.use: To buy fabrics to make various clothes to sell.

loans.name: Hayaoui

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 62 years old, is married, and has three children, two of whom work.
Hayaoui is a carpenter. In 1995, he opened his carpentry workshop, making bedrooms, living rooms, and doors. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and he knows about their needs. He has a good reputation, and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.
He is requesting $2400 loan in order to pay the annual rent and to add more inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Cris Luz

texts.es:
Cris es una joven de 29 años de edad, madre de un pequeño de 1 año 2 meses y el cual es su mayor bendición y la razón de que ella siga adelante a pesar de los obstáculos que se puedan presentar, a su lado está siempre su esposo, el cual trabaja como chofer de taxi y quien la apoya siempre; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Pucallpa, ciudad en la cual se encuentra una flora y fauna maravillosa, ciudad en la cual uno se desconecta de los problemas por lo maravillado que uno puede estar con todos esos paisajes hermosos que allí se encuentran. Como buena peruana le gusta mucho la comida de nuestro país y sobre todo su platillo favorito es el riquísimo Ceviche; cuando tiene un tiempito libre le gusta aprovecharlo realizando la limpieza de su hogar de manera minuciosa; ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar diseño Grafico.

Día a día Cris le levanta con muchos a niños para trabaja en su negocio de venta de comida, jugos y bebidas; le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 12 horas diarias y también apoya a su esposo en su trabajo como taxista; en el día atiende hasta 20 clientes y es que ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y porque es muy entusiasta y ese entusiasmo hace que los clientes regresen contentos a su negocio.

Cris está muy agradecida con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá construir una ramada que es una especie de techo hecho por materiales naturales, ya que en esta ciudad hace mucho calor y con ello mejoraría la atención a sus clientes. Así ella seguirá trabajando y luchando por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Cris, 29, is a young woman and mother of a one year and two month old little boy who is her greatest blessing and the reason for her to continue forward despite obstacles that might arise.  Her husband is always by her side; he works as a taxi driver and always supports her.

Her house is located in the city of Pucallpa, a city with marvelous flora and fauna and a city where one can disconnect from problems awed by the beautiful scenery found there.  Like all good Peruvians, she enjoys our country’s cuisine very much and her favorite dish is the very delicious Ceviche [marinated seafood].  When she has a little free time she likes to take advantage of it to thoroughly clean her house.  She only studied secondary school but would have liked to have studied Graphic Design.

Cris rises daily with much enthusiasm to work in her business selling food, juice and soft-drinks.  She spends about 12 hours daily at work and also helps her husband work as a taxi driver.  In a day she can tend to up to 20 customers and she believes she does well in her business because she’s kind to all her customers and because she’s very enthusiastic and that enthusiasm causes her customers to happily return to her business.

Cris is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to build a ‘ramada’ which is a type of overhang made from natural materials because it’s very hot in her community and this would improve her customer service so that she can continue working and striving toward making her greatest dream a reality:  to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to build a thatch overhang.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Unido De Suretka Group

texts.es:
Nancy es la presidenta de Banco Mujer Unido de Suretka, es un grupo con mucha trayectoria en Fundación Mujer,  y buena conducta de pago. 
Esta señora tiene 32 años, es casada, y no tiene hijos. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora, desarrolla diversas actividades, como el comercio, y tiene una pequeña pulpería, también vende comidas rápidas los fines de semana y días feriados y por si fuera poco elabora manualidades y vende en su comunidad, todo esto para contribuir  con los gastos familiares y además ayudarle a una hermana que estudia en la universidad. 
Este es el quinto crédito que solicita y los anteriores han sido de gran ayuda para consolidar y hacer crecer sus negocios. Y su meta es llegar a tener un pequeño supermercado que tenga  todo tipo de mercadería. 
Junto a Nancy hay 7 socias más,  que desarrollan actividades comerciales y agropecuarias.
texts.en:
Nancy is the president of the communal bank "Mujer Unido de Suretka."  This group has a long history with Fundacion Mujer, and has a good credit record.  Nancy is 32 years old, married, and has no children.  She is a very enterprising woman who has developed a number of different businesses, such as retail trade.  She has a small grocery store and she also sells fast food on the weekends and holidays, and last, but not least, she makes handicrafts which she sells in her community.  She does all of this to contribute to the household finances and also to help her brother who studies at the university.  She is requesting her 5th loan.  The previous loans really helped her to strengthen and grow her businesses.  Her goal is to eventually have a small supermarket where she could sell all types of merchandise.  

Next to Nancy, there are 7 other members of the group who are all developing retail or agricultural businesses.

loans.use:
to buy merchandise such as groceries, cleaning products, and other 
products for her store

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is a married mother of two children who are both in school. Her husband is a hotelier and Sidi has her own business selling clothes that she has been running for the last 2 years. The family lives in a rented room without access to water or electricity and their greatest monthly expenditures are food and water. 

Sidi wants to use the loan to add inventory and expand her existing business. She sells the clothes in a shop to female customers. The greatest challenges affecting her business are seasonality and the selling of items on credit. Sidi chose to work with Yehu because of lower interest rates than competing microfinance institutions. Her dream is to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and increase her inventory

loans.name: Dony Donadony

texts.es:
Dony es un joven de 21 años el cual es muy entusiasta y sobre todo muy hábil, vive al lado de su esposa y su pequeño hijo de 3 años de edad, para Dony es el mejor regalo que Dios le ha podido dar y la bendición más grande que una familia puede tener; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por playas hermosas, clima cálido y sobre todo porque es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano así como también por su riquísima sazón para la elaboración de platillos. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación Dony trabaja en su negocio como chofer de mototaxi en el cual trabaja 10 horas al día pero también tiene su negocio de venta de ropa en el cual es apoyado por su esposa quien se encarga de la atención del pequeño puesto de venta de ropa que tiene, en el día puede atender hasta 25 clientes y es que el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es amable y respetuoso con los clientes tanto en su negocio como chofer como en la venta de ropa y sobre todo porque da gracias a Dios tanto en las buenas como en las malas porque le ha permitido salir adelante a pesar de los obstáculos.

Dony está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio de ropa en especial ropa de invierno para niños y adultos y también comprar muebles y un juego de comedor para su casa, con lo cual mejorar sus ingresos y también brindara comodidad a su familia y asi el seguirá luchando cada día por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una mototaxi propia y mejorar su negocio de venta de ropa”.
texts.en:
Dony, 21, is a young, very enthusiastic but above all very skilled man.  He lives with his wife and three year old little boy who for Dony is the best gift God could have given him and the greatest blessing a family can have.  

His house is located in the city of Chincha, a city noted for its beautiful beaches, hot weather and above all because it’s the birthplace of great Peruvian sports heroes and because of the tasty way its cuisine is prepared.

With much effort and dedication, Dony works driving a mototaxi for about 10 hours daily but also has a business selling clothes that his wife helps him with; she tends to the small clothes selling stand they have.  In a day he can take care of up to 25 customers and he believes he does well because of the kind and respectful way he treats his customers both in the business and as a taxi driver and above all because he thanks God both in good times and in bad because He’s made it possible for him to get ahead despite obstacles.

Dony is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given him he will be buy more merchandise for his clothing business especially winter clothes for children and adults and will also buy furniture and a dining room set for his house that he’ll improve his income with and provide better comfort for his family to continue striving daily to make his greatest dream a reality: to own a mototaxi and to improve his clothing sales business.

loans.use: to buy winter clothes and a dining room set.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is an industrious and responsible wife and mother to her four children. She is 57 years of age and a married woman. She and her husband have operated their fish pond and hog raising businesses for ten years. 

Teresita aims to improve the growth of her fingerlings due to the many orders. To accomplish her plans, she is requesting additional working capital in the amount of P10,000. She will use this loan to purchase aqua feeds and livestock feeds for raising hogs and fingerlings. She hopes that she could increase the number of her fingerlings in order to get greater income and to satisfy her customer demand.

Teresita would be thankful if the loan she requested is granted. She is also hoping for growth improvement of the hogs she is raising. This way, she could lift her living condition out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy aqua feeds and livestock feeds for raising hogs and fingerlings

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia es una joven de 33 años, la cual es muy luchadora y sobre todo optimista y para ella no existe un no puedo, vive al lado de su esposo el cual es su mano derecha en todo y al lado de su mejor y más importante regalo que Dios y la vida le han podido dar, su hija de 2 años la cual con su sonrisa hace que Silvia se olvide de los problemas y siga adelante; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener uno de los atractivos turísticos más importantes del país, el cual son las Islas Ballestas y el candelabro de Paracas, así como también playas hermosas; gracias a estos bellísimos lugares Silvia trabajo en una agencia de turismo y allí aprendió mucho y por ello tuvo la iniciativa de tener una agencia de turismo, con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro logro salir adelante y su negocio ya lleva 4 años; ella cree que le va bien porque es muy amable y honrada con los turistas y sobre todo porque tiene un carisma singular cuando atiende a los clientes.

Silvia está muy agradecida con la ayuda y la oportunidad que los prestatarios Kiva le han brindado ya que gracias a ello Silvia podrá realizar la remodelación y ambientación de su agencia de turismo y podrá comprar los accesorios para su oficina y con ello dar una mejor atención a los clientes y con ello mejorar sus ingresos, así ella seguirá luchando día a día para ver hecho realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a  su hija y crecer en su agencia de Turismo”.
texts.en:
Silvia, 33, is a very tenacious but above all optimistic young woman; for her "I can’t" does not exist.  She lives with her husband who is her right hand in everything she does and with her two year old daughter who’s the most important gift God and life could possibly give her; just with her smile she makes Silvia forget her problems and carry on.

Her house is located in the city of Pisco, a city noted for having one of the country’s most important tourist attractions: the Ballestas Islands and the Paracas Candelabrum as well as beautiful beaches.  Thanks to these very beautiful places Silvia worked for a travel agency and learned much there so then she decided to have a travel agency herself and with much effort and saving managed to do so; her business has been in operation four years now.  She believes she does well in it because she’s very kind and honest with tourists and above all because she has a singular charisma when she takes care of them.

Silvia is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her Silvia will be able to remodel and upgrade her tourist agency and will be able to buy accessories for her office to provide better customer service thus improving her income to continue striving day to day to make her greatest dream a reality:  to give her daughter a good education and to make her tourist agency grow.

loans.use: to remodel her tourist agency.

loans.name: Hadie

texts.en:
Hadie is a married mother of four children and has a business selling water. Three of her children are in school and one is still too young to attend. Her husband works as a mason. She runs her business from her family home, which they own and which has access to both electricity and water. Their greatest monthly expenses are school fees. 

Hadie would like to use the loan to open a cafe business, as she has five years experience within the industry. Her customers would be neighbors and people from Mkokoleni. Hadie anticipates the challenge of running this business and will be careful with money management as she will be selling on credit. Hadie's dream for a long time has been to open her own cafe. 

Hadie wants to work hard to increase their sources of income to ensure that all of her four children successfully manage to complete their schooling from start to finish.

loans.use: to open a new cafe

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy diving equipment and an air compressor.

loans.name: Domingo José

texts.es:
El señor Domingo José, es casado,  trabaja  para el ministerio de salud como técnico en vectores de ciudad de León, inicia sus labores de 7:00 am a 3:00 pm de lunes a viernes.

Domingo solicitó a ceprodel un segundo crédito para compra  zinc, piedrín y golosos, los que serán utilizados para cambio de techo de su vivienda ya que está en mal estado, en vista que se aproxima la temporada lluviosa.

Domingo se siente agradecido con Ceprodel  por el apoyo que  le ha brindado para mejorar su vivienda y la calidad de vida de él y toda su familia.
texts.en:
Domingo José is married and is employed by the Ministry of Health as a Vectors Technician in the city of León; he works from 7am until 3pm, Monday through Friday.

Domingo asked Ceprodel for a second loan to buy metal sheeting, gravel and screws he’ll use to replace the roof on his house because it’s in bad shape and the rainy season is approaching.

Domingo is grateful to Ceprodel for the support provided to improve his house and his and his entire family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, gravel and screws.

loans.name: Carlos German

texts.es:
El joven Carlos German, es soltero con deseo de superación,  trabaja  como operario en una zona franca  de  la ciudad de León, sus labores la realiza en turno variado.

Carlos  solicitó a ceprodel su primer crédito para compra  cemento, bloque,  arena, hierro y piedrín, para construcción de un cuarto.

El Joven se siente agradecido  con Ceprodel  por la oportunidad que  le ha brindado de obtener su cuarto donde tendrá una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos German is a single young man with a desire to overcome. He works as an operator in a tax-free zone in the city of León. He works different shifts.

Carlos asked for his first loan from Ceprodel in order to buy cement, blocks, sand, iron, and gravel to build a room.

He is grateful to Ceprodel for the opportunity it has given him to obtain his room, where he will have better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cement, blocks, sand, iron, and gravel

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Carmen tiene 51 años y es casada con 2 hijos que son de las edades de 16 y 18 años,  ella se dedica  al venta de ropa, su puesto  se encuentran en la ciudad de Oruro, compra ropa en la ciudad de la Paz y va  a vender ropa a la ciudad de Oruro ella, viaja dos veces a la semana los días miércoles y sábados que son los días de feria en la ciudad de Oruro, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Carmen va a utilizar este préstamo de para compra de diferentes modelos de ropa para surtir su negocio con variedad de prendas de vestir,  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es aumento de inventario. La Sra. Carmen enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia, ella va a utilizar los beneficios llegando de apoco a tener una tienda propia en la ciudad de La Paz y así no tener que viajar ya que es un poco agotador para ella pero tiene que hacerlo por el bienestar de su familia. En la foto la Sra. Carmen se encuentra en compañía de su esposo.
texts.en:
Carmen, 51, is married and has two children who are 16 and 18 year sold.  She sells clothes.  Her stand is located in the city of Oruro.  She buys clothes in the city of La Paz and goes to sell it in the city of Oruro.  She travels twice a week on Wednesdays and Saturdays which are the market days in the city of Oruro.  

This is her first loan sequence within the institution.  Carmen will use this loan to buy various styles of clothes to stock her business with a variety of articles of clothing.  Her reason for requesting the loan is to increase her inventory.  

The business challenge Carmen faces is competition.  She will use profits to gradually obtain a store of her own in the city of La Paz so as not to have to travel any longer which is a bit exhausting for her but she has to do it for her family’s wellbeing.  

In the photo Carmen appears in the company of her husband.

loans.use: to buy various styles of clothing.

loans.name: Froilan

texts.es: El Sr. Froilán tiene 45 años y es casado con 2 hijos de las edades de 10 y 19 años, su actividad es la de venta de alimentos en un snack cafetería que se encuentran en una de las avenidas más populosas de la ciudad de El alto, este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Froilán va a usar este préstamo para la compra de una computadora para los estudios de sus hijos,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es pensando en la educación de sus hijos, el Sr. Froilán enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia diaria ya que por la zona existen varias cafeterías y va a utilizar los beneficios en el apoyo educativo de sus hijos. Su deseo para su negocio es verse como un empresario, administrando una cadena de cafeterías en la ciudad de El Alto.
texts.en:
Froilán, 45, is married and has two children who are 10 and 19 years old.  His activity is selling food in a snack bar located in one of the city of El Alto’s most crowded avenues.

This loan is his third sequence within the institution.  Froilán will use the loan to buy a computer for his children’s school work.  His reason for requesting the loan is thinking about his children’s education.

The business challenge Froilán faces is daily competition because there are several cafeterias in his zone.  He will use profits to support his children’s education.  His wish for his business is to see himself as a businessman running a chain of cafeterias in the city of El Alto.

loans.use: to buy a computer fo his children's school work.

loans.name: Wilfredo Edilberto

texts.es:
Wilfredo tiene 30 años de edad, es soltero. Él se ha sido empleado en una farmacia en el área de ventas, hoy en día esta trabajando en una gasolinera y fue en este trabajo que se de cuenta del potencial que tenia el negocio de comida, ubicado en una pequeña casa cerca de la gasolinera. Él se aventuro e instalo el negocio y obtuvo muy buenos resultados, ya que al mismo tiempo que trabaja en la gasolinera tiene su propio negocio y a contratado a una persona para que lo atienda. Su horario de trabajo es de 9:00 a.m. a 9:00 p.m.

Los productos se los llegan a dejar al negocio los distribuidores. El préstamo que esta solicitando Wilfredo es para comprar vitrinas, estantes, mesas, mostrador de comida, panes para hacer hot dog y hamburguesas. De esta forma ampliara su negocio, será más prospero y tendrá más oportunidad de vender, percibiendo más y mejores ingresos por que que muchos clientes ya no llegan a comprar por falta de productos.

Wilfredo se ve en un futuro con otro local más cercano a la gasolinera o bien cerca de donde vive él.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 30 years old and single.  He’s been an employee in a pharmacy in the sales area and today is working at a gas station.  It was in this job that he noted the potential a food business located in a small house near the gas station had.  He took the leap and installed the business and got very good results because while being employed in the gas station he also has a business of his own and he hired a person to tend to it.  His work schedule is 9am to 9pm.

His products are delivered by suppliers directly to the business.  The loan Wilfredo is asking for is to buy display cases, shelving, tables, a food counter and bread for hot-dogs and hamburgers.  In this way he will expand the business, it will be more profitable and he’ll have more sales opportunities thus earning more and improved income because many customers don’t get to buy because of lack of products.  Wilfredo sees in his future another locale even closer to the gas station or near where he lives.

loans.use: to buy display cases, shelving, tables, counter and bread to make hot-dogs and hamburgers.

loans.name: Mirador De Yahuarcocha Group

texts.es:
El mirador de Yahuarcocha es un grupo de 5 mujeres emprendedoras, que tienen un mismo fin, que es el de salir adelante con su negocio para mejorar su calidad de vida. En este grupo la presidenta es Paola, en la fotografía es la segunda persona empezando desde la izquierda, se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora y muy responsable. Vive en la ciudad de Ibarra con sus padres.

Paola trabaja junto con sus compañeras en un taller de confección de blusas de tela indú. Es el primer crédito que realiza en Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de una máquina de cocer industrial, que ayudará a optimizar tiempo y ayudará a una mejor productividad.

Paola sueña en tener un taller grande para poder emplear a personas que necesiten.
texts.en:
El Mirador de Yahuarcocha is a group of 5 entrepreneurial women who have the same goal, which is to move forward with their business in order to improve their quality of life. In this group the president is Paola. In the photograph she is the second person starting from the left. She is known for being an entrepreneurial woman, hard-working, and very responsible. She lives in the city of Ibarra with her parents.

Paola works together with her coworkers in a workshop making shirts of Indian fabric. This is her first loan with Fodemi, and it will be used to purchase an industrial sewing machine that will help to save time and increase productivity.

Paola dreams of having a large workshop in order to be able to employ people who need it.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Felicia; Ella continúa realizando sus actividades diarias con el negocio de alquiler de habitaciones de su casa, y también trabaja en venta de productos de belleza y ropa interior para damas.
Felicia por medio de estos negocios independientes saca adelante a sus hijos, y por ello  quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de alquiler de cuartos, conjuntamente con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza y ropa interior. 
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como pintura y otros accesorios, para dar los acabados a  las habitaciones y posteriormente alquilarlas; y por supuesto para capitalizar su actividad adicional de comprar productos de belleza y ropa interior femenina al por mayor.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORIMANKACHA”; El banco está ubicado en la ciudad de Cusco - Perú
texts.en:
Felicia continues carrying out her daily activities with her business renting rooms in her house and also works selling beauty products and women’s underwear.

Through these independent businesses Felicia is able to support her children and because of this wants to expand and improve the room rental business as well as the business selling beauty products and underwear.

She is asking for a loan to buy building materials and supplies like paint and other accessories to give the rooms their finishing touches to subsequently rent them out and also to capitalize her additional activity buying beauty products and women’s underwear at wholesale.

She’s happy with the loan and committed to make her installment payments.  She belongs to the “Qorimankacha” communal bank located in the city of Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to buy building supplies and beauty products.

loans.name: Mercidia

texts.es: Mercedita es una emprendedora que ya ha venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000 en crédito en el cual en el crédito anterior la emprendedora lo invirtió en el negocio en la compra de productos, nos expresa que gracias al apoyo brindado ha aumentado su producto y de igual manera sus clientes. La emprendedora esta nuevamente solicitando financiamiento para la compra de productos para ofrecerle a sus clientes como pantalones, camisas, sandalias, blúmer entre otras productos.
texts.en: Mercedita is an entrepreneur who has been working with Fundación León 2000 financing.  She used her previous loan to invest in her business purchasing products.  She tells us that thanks to the support provided she’s increased her products as well as the number of her customers.  She is once again asking for financing to buy products to offer her customers like pants, shirts, sandals and underwear, among other products.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Nelson Alfredo

texts.es:
Nelson es una persona trabajadora, responsable y muy preocupado por su familia. Nelson vive con su familia en Pimampiro que se encuentra a una hora de Ibarra en la Provincia de Imbabura.

Nelson tiene sembríos de tomate en invernadero, necesita seguir sembrando para tener una buena producción de tomates y que su negocio siga creciendo, lo cual realiza un nuevo crédito en Fodemi que lo va a invertir en la compra de  semillas de tomate, abono, y fungicidas para seguir en el sembrío y obtener una buena producción e incrementar sus ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Nelson sueña en construir otro invernadero para que sus tomates sean de buena calidad.
texts.en:
Nelson is a hardworking, responsible person who is very concerned for his family.  He lives with his family in Pimampiro which is located an hour away from Ibarra in Imbabura Province.

Nelson has tomatoes growing in a greenhouse and needs to continue planting in order to have a good tomato production and for his business to continue growing so he’s taking out a new Fodemi loan to buy tomato seeds, manure and fungicide to continue planting and to obtain a good production and increase his income to improve his family’s quality of life.

Nelson dreams with building another greenhouse so that his tomatoes will be of good quality.

loans.use: to buy tomato seeds, manure and fungicide.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane, a 40-year-old single woman with four children, has been operating a salon business for two years now, earning a monthly income of 70,000 shillings. With her first loan from KADET LTD, she plans to buy more beauty products. In the future Jane wants to boost her business and improve the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products.

loans.name: Kasindi Bus Women Group

texts.en: Jackline is a 33 year old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in the cutlery business for fifteen years. She started with 1,000,000 shillings and now has 2,500,000 shillings in working capital. Her main hardships are price fluctuations and inflation, and her personal goal is educating her children. Her business goal is to expand business into new markets. Jackline wants money to buy home utensils to sell.

loans.use: to buy utensils to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a mother of five children aged between seven and fourteen; all of the children are enrolled in school. She has been selling clothes for 16 years. She wants the loan to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a 26-year-old young woman; she is married to Mohammad and a mother with three sons and three daughters. Her husband is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's costs and needs.

Samar is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing new living room furniture. Getting this loan will allow Samar to improve her family's living conditions at home by having comfortable living room furniture. Samar appears in the picture holding her baby .

loans.use: to purchase new living room furniture

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en: Consolata, a 49-year-old widow with five children between the ages of 18 and 25, all in school, has been working as a tailor for the past three years. With this loan she wants to buy threads and a sewing machine to use in her business. Consalata will pay her children's school fees with the resulting extra profits.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and threads for her business.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel  es una mujer de 19 años de edad, estado civil soltero. Vive  en casa de sus padres. La casa está ubicada en el caserío Ex Aterrizaje La Peña  distrito de Tambogrande y cuenta con servicio de luz, el lugar es una ciudad de aproximadamente 80 familias.
La actividad que desarrolla Maribel es  la venta de productos de belleza, también se dedica ala crianza de animales menores como aves de corral y caprinos  y los cría en parte exterior de su domicilio con apoyo de su madre. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 01 años aproximadamente,  y aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce este tipo de negocio. 
El monto del crédito solicitado   es de 1500 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán para invertir en la compra de productos de belleza  y compra de alimentos para engorde de sus animales ;y  poder atender a sus clientes en esta zona, lo cual le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Maribel is a single, 19-year-old woman. She lives in her parents house, located in the Ex Atterrizaje La Pena settlement, in Tambogrande district. The town of approximately 80 families has electrical service.

Maribel's main activity is selling beauty products. Also, she raises farm animals, such as chickens and goats, around her house with her mother's help. Maribel has been doing this for approximately one year. She learned the skill from her parents. Now she knows this type of business.

The amount of the loan Maribel is requesting is 1,500 new sols, which will be invested in purchasing beauty products and feed for fattening her animals. Then, she will be able to attend to her local customers, permitting her level of life to improve.

loans.use: buy beauty products to sell and feed for fattening her livestock.

loans.name: Gladys Ruth

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Gladis; ella tiene 66 años de edad, está casada y  tiene 3 hijos ya adultos; Gladis es educadora y trabaja enseñando en un jardín de niños.

Gladis Solicita un préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción, ya que está haciendo mejoras su casa y necesita darle los acabados para terminar de construir.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Qorimankacha”; de la ciudad del  de Cusco.
texts.en:
Gladis, 66, is the member.  She’s married and has three adult children.  She’s a teacher and works teaching in a kindergarten.

Gladis is asking for a loan to buy building materials and supplies because she’s doing some home improvements and needs the finishing touches to complete construction.

She thanks those who by this means form part of this dream and commits to make her installment payments according to the schedule.  She belongs to the “Qorimankacha” communal bank in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy building supplies to finish building her house.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is 25 years old and lives in the town of Kasagati in the Kampala east region of Uganda. For the past five years, Justine has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like soap and salt for resale, and it will help Justine generate greater profits and expand her business. Justine hopes that in the future she will be able to own a big wholesale shop. 

Justine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Justine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like soap and salt for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy plates, saucepans, and glasses to sell.

loans.name: Jean Leonard

texts.en: Jean Leonard is 30 years old. He sells clothes. He has been in this business for seven years. With the loan, he wants to buy more sweaters and trousers to sell. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for his family. He would love to see his business prosper to the extent of becoming a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy more sweaters and trousers to sell.

loans.name: Josè Manuel

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 39 años de edad, estado civil conviviente, con 01 hijo a su cargo. Vive  en casa  propia  con su cónyuge y su hijo. La casa está ubicada en el distrito de Cayalti de la provincia de Chiclayo y cuenta con servicio básicos agua, desagüe de luz, el lugar es  de aproximadamente 600 familias.
La actividad que desarrolla José  es  la venta de productos de primera necesidad como: aceite, arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, etc. y los comercializa en una parte de su domicilio donde atiende todos los días de la semana, así mismo se dedica al transporte de pasajeros con su mototaxi. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 6 años aproximadamente,  y aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Complementariamente su cónyuge le apoya en el negocio.
El monto del crédito solicitado   es de 4000 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán para invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para su bodega y además va comprar dos play station que son juegos y poder atender a sus clientes en esta zona, lo cual le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
José, 39, has a spouse and one son in his care.  He lives in his own house which is located in Cayalti District in Chiclayo Province with his spouse and son; it has the basic utilities of water, sewage and electricity.  The place has approximately 600 families.

The activity José does is selling basic staple items like rice, oil, sugar, noodles, milk, etc.  He sells them in part of his house where he takes care of customers every day of the week.  He also works transporting passengers in his mototaxi.  He’s been in this activity for approximately six years having learned it from his parents which means he knows the line of work to perfection.  Hi spouse helps him with the business.
