Jocelyn has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, canned goods, egg, detergent and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en: Magdalena is a woman of two children, all enrolled in school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. For the last 7 years, she has been selling food stuff through door-to-door sales.  She plans to use the loan of Ksh.30000 to buy bales of wheat flour. Magdalena describes seasonality to be her major challenge. Her greatest monthly expense are school fees and food, and she aspires to open a restaurant in the future.

loans.use: to buy bales of wheat flour.

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en:
Hiyam is a 50-year-old married woman whose husband is a butcher. They have four sons, one of whom is married. 

Surrounded by men in her family, Hiyam wanted to keep up her feminine side so she started a few years ago making and arranging fake flowers at home. Recently she was able to use her profits to open a small shop to sell those fake flowers, and also started selling different types of accessories. 

She has applied for this loan to bring in more accessories to the shop and make some new shelves for them.

loans.use: to bring in more accessories to the shop

loans.name: Jamil

texts.en:
Jamil is a 50-year-old married man and the father of three children. He has been working as a taxi driver for 13 years. His family expenses are increasing, which is why he was searching for another source of income. Jamil opened a cafe where he sells Manakish (a special Lebanese dough topped with thyme, cheese or other tasty ingredients, like a folded pizza usually eaten for breakfast). His Manakish are special since the dough is like pita bread which gives it a unique taste. He also sells soft drinks and sweets. 

Jamil works as a taxi driver day and night, managing between the two businesses, and he hopes to expand both businesses. Jamil applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to support his newly established cafe business, because he believes that the more you invest in a certain business, the more it sprouts in the future. Most of his customers are relatives, neighbors and friends. He hopes one day most of the tourists he works with through his taxi business will come and taste his delicious Manakish.

loans.use: To support his newly established cafe business

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a mother of three children, all of whom are enrolled in school. She operates a private school and intends to use the loan of KES 30,000 to buy school stationery. Her primary customers are students. She has been in this business for the last three years. Catherine aspires to hire employees in the future. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Catherine joined Kiva's partner, Yehu, to obtain the funds needed to expand her school.

loans.use: to buy school stationery.

loans.name: Thou

texts.en:
Thou is 50 years old. She is a mother of four children and resides with her husband in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has been selling Khmer noodles for more than 10 years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $4 per day. Three of her children are also construction workers. They earn approximately $15 per day. 

Thou wants to run an additional business in order to improve her family’s finances. Due to lack of funds, Thou is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase a tuk tuk, or motorcycle-based taxi,  for her husband to run a taxi service. By doing so, he would earn additional income to support the family. In the future, she would like to rebuild her present house to make it more convenient for her family's living conditions and to help her youngest child earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a tuk tuk for her husband to run a taxi service

loans.name: Las Morenitas (Flat) Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama las morenitas y se integra de cuatro señoras quien cada una se dedica a su respectiva actividad  y vive en el barrio de santa Cecilia el barrio de los músicos.
Quine se le tomo la entre vista se llama rebeca  quien tiene treinta años de edad y  es casada con el señor Adelaido, con quien procreo dos hijos que a un están a su responsabilidad.

   Ella solicito el préstamo  para invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos de la marca Avon en donde lleva trabajando  un año  y seis meses en la que comenta que le va bien ay que con ello  está obteniendo ingresos en su hogar.

   Inicio con esta actividad ya que con ello podrá ayudar  a su esposo y no solo se vea obligado a aportar solo  el así que juntos decidieron trabajar para darle lo más necesario a su  pequeña familia.

       Lo que rebeca desea es que con esta pequeña actividad ella logre seguir adelante y con el tiempo  también  tener otro trabajo que le dé un buen resultado.
 
    Quienes se integran en el grupo son: la señora  Virginia  invertir el préstamo  en la compra  de ingredientes para  la elaboración  de tamales, la señora  Norma Alicia  invertirá en la compra de ropas , la señora  María Elizabeth  invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de tamales.
texts.en:
The group is called “Las Morenitas” and it’s composed of four ladies each with her respective activity; they live in the Santa Cecilia neighborhood, the neighborhood of musicians.

Rebeca was interviewed.  She’s 30 years old and is married to Adelaido; they have two children who are still their responsibility. 

She requested the loan to buy Avon brand cosmetics; she’s been working at that for a year and six months and she comments that she does well there in that she’s earning income for her household.

She started this activity so that she could help her husband and he wouldn’t have to shoulder the entire obligation by himself so they decided together to work to provide what’s most necessary for their small family.

What Rebeca wants from this small activity is to manage to continue forward and in time to have another job that will give her good results.

The members of the group are:  Virginia who will use the loan to buy ingredients to make tamales, Norma Alicia who will buy clothes and María Elizabeth who will buy ingredients to make tamales.

loans.use: to pay for Avon brand cosmetics.

loans.name: Las Amapolas (Flat) Group

texts.es:
El grupo  se  llama "Las Amapolas" y se integra de cuatro señoras quienes cada una tienen su respectiva actividad  y viven en barrio Santa Ana.
Quien se le tomo la entrevista se llama  Claudia quien es casada con el señor  Joel con quien procreo dos hijos quienes a un están a su responsabilidad y estudian en prepa y universidad.
Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de  insumos para elaborar  tortas y licuados en donde lleva trabajando  quince años, ella nos comenta: "es un buen negocio", su esposo fue quien inicio con esta actividad, tambien tiene un teléfono publico que le deja buenas ganancias.
Inicio con esta actividad para apoyar a su esposo con el trabajo y así juntos trabajar para darle lo necesario a su pequeña familia.
Lo que desea es que con esta pequeña actividad ella pueda seguir  agrandando  mas su negocio  y  seguir adelante con su hogar.
Las integrantes del grupo son: Elizabeth invertirá en su bonetería y mercería,  María Guadalupe invertirá en la compra de tamales, Virginia también invertirá en la elaboración de tamates para vender en los barrios.
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Amapolas’ (The Poppies) and is composed of four women each with her own activity; they live in the Santa Ana neighborhood.

Claudia is the name of the one interviewed.  She’s married to Joel and they have two children who are still their responsibility and who attend high school and university.

She requested the loan to buy ingredients to make tortas [Mexican sandwiches] and blended fruit drinks.  She’s been in this occupation for 15 years and comments: “it’s a good business.” Her husband started the business and she also has a public phone that produces good profits.

She started with this activity in order to help her husband with his work and thus work together to give their small family what it needed.

What she wants from this small activity is to be able to continue expanding the business more and to continue forward with her home.

The members of the group are: Elizabeth who will buy notions and miscellany, María Guadalupe who will buy tamales and Virginia who will also invest in making tamales to sell in the neighborhoods.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make tortas and blended fruit drinks.

loans.name: Esthela Mercedes

texts.es: Esthela de 45 años, es una mujer trabajadora que vende productos naturales.  Recorre las calles de Milagro vendiendo productos Naturales a diversas personas. Escogio esta actividad porque muy pocas personas de Milagro vende esta clase de productos. Le gusta su trabajo por eso quiere seguir con la venta de estos productos. Con el préstamo desea comprar productos naturales para tener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Esthela is 45 years old. She is a working woman who sells natural products. She traverses the streets of Milagro selling natural products to diverse people. 

She chose this activity because few people in Milagro sell this type of product. She likes her work and so she wants to continue selling her product. 

With the money from the loan she wants to buy natural products in order to have more income.

loans.use: to buy natural products to sell

loans.name: Roselia

texts.en:
Roselia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a shell's craft vending business in the Philippines.

Roselia requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her shell's craft vending business.

She has been in this business for 20 years now, and also earns additional income from coconut wine.

In the future, Roselia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her shells crafting business.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is from the village of Capellan. She is 31 years old, married and has one school-aged child. Irene owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of products. Irene has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns PHP 4,000 a month. Her previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Irene is requesting a new loan of PHP 15,000 which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products for her store

loans.name: Rahmeh

texts.en:
Rahmeh is a 33-year-old married lady. Her husband is a taxi driver; they have three lovely daughters. 

Rahmeh started a small retail business selling blankets and bed covers to add another source of income to the family. But now, Rahmeh has applied for this loan to add selling clothes which will help in increasing the revenue.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en: Dolores works hard to support her family. She is married and has operated a business selling dried fish in the Philippines for 5 years. Dolores requested a loan of PHP 10,000 through Kiva's partner, NWTF, to buy more dried fish to sell. In the future, Dolores would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Leni

texts.en:
Leni works hard to support her family. She is single and has a sari-sari (general) store business in the Philippines. 

Leni requested a 20,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her store. 

She has been in this business for five years. In the future, Leni would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a married woman with 6 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Leonora is 34 years old and has 4 children who are in school.

Leonora has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing equipment.

Leonora has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Leonora would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita works hard to support her family. Margarita is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Margarita requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

Margarita has been in this business for 9 years now, and also earns additional income from fish vending.

In the future, Margarita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Linglingay

texts.en:
Linglingay, 56, lives in Lasam. She is in the business of selling personal products collections such as Nataha, Splash and Avon. She is thankful with the business she started because she has improved their economic situation. She works hard every day with the desire to upgrade her income.

In addition to these efforts, she is seeking additional working capital from ASKI in order to provide her customers with their desired products. She is requesting a loan of PHP12,000 to buy lotion, lipstick, face powder, cream and makeup. With the loan, Linglingay is hoping for a better lifestyle and business situation.

loans.use: to buy lotion, lipstick, face powder, cream and makeup

loans.name: Hizon

texts.en:
Hizon is a hard working father of three children. He is a farmer planting rice in the Philippines. His wife is a housekeeper and his partner in managing their rice field. At the age of 51, Hizon still has the eagerness to manage his farm.

Through his earnings from farming, Hizon is able to send his children to school. Now Hizon is happy that all of his effort have produced good fruit. His children are now holding degrees and are able to help him financially, even in small amounts. Hizon wants to maintain his farming business. He doesn’t want to rely only on his children to provide for the needs of his farm. Hence Hizon is asking for a loan of 50,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy seeds, fertilizers and herbicides.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and herbicides.

loans.name: El Guayabo Group

texts.es:
Vicenta es una mujer humilde y muy trabajadora, cuenta con 52 años, es madre soltera tiene 1 hijo que cuenta con el apoyo de su madre para seguir con sus estudios.
Vicenta se dedica a la venta de pan, tiene 17 años con su negocio, piensa invertir su próximo préstamo  en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de los panes, Vicenta nos cuenta que le beneficiará en mejorar su calidad de vida, una de sus metas que tiene para su negocio es poder incrementar tanto ventas como ganancias.
Vicenta es integrante del Grupo El Guayabo y está conformado por 11 integrantes que a continuación se mencionan: Eugenio, María divina, Sonia, Sabina, Vicenta Valeriano , Romelia, Vicenta Zamora, María Félix, Francisco, Mirna y Alfredo, lo cual se dedican al comercio y venden: Pan, Refrescos, Chicharrones y Gelatinas, Maíz, Carne de cerdos, Flores, Pescados, Dulces y Tacos.
texts.en:
Vicenta is a modest and very hardworking woman.  She is 52 years old and the single mother of one child who has his mother's support to continue with his studies.

Vicenta sells bread.  She has had this business for 17 years.  She plans to invest her next loan in buying supplies to make bread.  Vicenta tells us that it will benefit her in improving her quality of life.  One of her objectives for her business is to be able to increase her sales as well as her profits.

Vicenta is a member of the El Guayabo group, made up of 11 members here named: Eugenio, María Divina, Sonia, Sabina, Vicenta Valeriano, Romelia, Vicenta Zamora, María Félix, Francisco, Mirna, and Alfredo.  They sell bread, beverages, pork cracklings and gelatin, corn, pork, flowers, fish, sweets, and tacos.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make bread, such as flour, eggs, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 38 years old and married with two children.  With all her children in school, Yolanda works very hard to provide for them.

Yolanda runs a sari sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods such as canned goods, snack foods, detergent and other miscellaneous items.

Yolanda has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, snack foods, etc. 

In the future Yolanda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell such as canned goods, snack foods, detergent and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Coralyn

texts.en:
At the age of 35, Coralyn has three children to support. Two of them are attending to school. Coralyn's spouse is a jeepney operator. To help her spouse generate income for the family, Coralyn started a candy-making business. She makes peanut butter ideal for sandwich spreads, tamarind and purple jams. Aside from that, she also breeds and raises hogs to fatten for future sale. 

She is borrowing a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy hog feed, vitamins and medicine for sustainability. This will help ensure the good growth and nutrition of her hogs. She hopes to keep improving the hog raising business and to keep earning funds for her children's education. Coralyn will be happy and proud to see all her children be professionals someday.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins and medicine for sustainability

loans.name: Elizbar

texts.en:
Elizbar is 49 years old. He lives in the Chokhatauri District with his family:his wife Guliko, and their 26-year-old son, daughter-in-law, and 1-year-old grandson. The family earns a living through a small-scale family agricultural business. In particular, they have a milk cow. Guliko produces dairy products, which is mainly consumed in the family; a small surplus is sold in the village. Also the family owns 300 nut trees in their garden. Elizbar sells nuts to local retailers. 

Elizbar has a chronic health problems and he gets a relevant pension from the government. According to local government’s estimation, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category and they receive relevant social assistance. The total average monthly income of the family is 250 Laris, including Elizbar’s pension and social assistance.

Elizbar requested credit for purchasing a mini tractor. His loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to low income. With the received credit, Elizbar will purchase a mini tractor. His son will provide tilling services to village farmers and will be paid for this. The family will get additional source of the income and they will be able to improve their living conditions. In addition to the above mentioned, in the future the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase a mini tractor.

loans.name: Manuchar

texts.en:
Manuchar is 32 years old. He lives in the small village of Tskaltubo District with his family: his wife Maya, his 3-year-old daughter, and his mother. Maya works in a local company in nearby town and gets a monthly salary. Manuchar grows maize on a family-owned plot of the land. He works hard in the cornfield, especially in spring and summer periods. Manuchar sells the harvested maize on local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 450 Laris per month. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

Manuchar requested credit for the start up of an agricultural business. His loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to their low income. With the received credit, Manuchar will start a new type of family business. The family owns greenhouse constructions in the village. Manuchar will purchase polyethylene covers and make the greenhouses functional. He will grow greens and vegetables in the greenhouses during the whole year and sell them on the local open market. The income of the family will significantly increase. Manuchar will be able to improve the living conditions for his family members. Along with the above mentioned, in the future the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase a polyethylen cover for the greenhouses.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a electronics repair shop business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy electrical tools and equipment for her electronics repair shop business.

Julia has been in this business for 25 years. Julia earns more income from her general store.

Julia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy electrical tools and equipment.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is 65 years old and married with 11 children. Marieta works very hard to provide for them.

Marieta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Marieta has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, shampoo and groceries. 

In the future, Marieta would like to save enough to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en: Raphael a 33-year-old man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He used the previous loan to buy charcoal for sale and with the profits he was able to pay school fees for his children. He has hardships of inadequate capital to purchase enough stock to meet the high demand he faces. However, he has a vision of buying land to grow crops, educating his children and building a permanent home. Raphael intends to buy firewood and charcoal for resale with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy firewood and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is a 32-year-old married man with two children. He has been raising hogs for 5 years. Edgar loves and enjoys raising hogs a lot. He has stated that providing necessary vaccines and feeds to the hogs will help improve their growth.

Edgar is requesting a loan of 35,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to allow him to buy feeds and vaccines for his raised hogs. He believes that his hard work and this loan amount will give him a positive impact in improving his business. Edgar would be glad if he had continuous access to financial services in order to gain more profit to improve his living condition and save some money for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vaccines for his livestock business.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 53 years old and married with 4 children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Rosalinda is borrowing 20000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rosalinda has been farming vegetables for 9 years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Olivia works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle repair business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from charcoal sales and rice retailing. Olivia is borrowing 18000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy machine tools and equipment for her motorcycle repair shop business.

Olivia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough money to put up another motorcycle repair shop.

loans.use: to buy machine tools and equipment for her repair shop.

loans.name: Victoire

texts.en:
Victoire is 24 years old and is married with a five-month old child. Her husband is a businessman. For the past two years, Victoire has been selling shoes. 

Victoire is requesting a loan to buy more shoes to sell. With the profits from her business, she plans to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 51 years old and is married with seven children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past 10 years, she has run a dried-fish business in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Marivic is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 48 years old and is a  poultry-keeper in Shanzu, Mombasa. He is a married and the father of four children who all go to school. Simon has been raising poultry for the past five years with great success. He was recently introduced to KADET LTD.

Simon is requesting his third loan to finance his business. He will purchase more chicks and chicken feed. Simon will use the profits from his loan to expand his business and to repay his loan. He hopes to have a happy, prosperous family.

loans.use: to purchase year-old chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Tany Miguel

texts.es:
Tany es un joven entusiasta y trabajador, junto a su pareja tienen 2 preciosos hijos de 4 y 2 años que son su adoración y su razón de vida y su motor para luchar día a día y ser mejor por ellos; su vivienda se ubica en el distrito de Parcona, el cual se caracteriza por albergar el Bosque de Piedras, que son aglomeraciones de cerros en forma de animales, persona, entre otros, asimismo se caracteriza por su agricultura y por la amabilidad de sus pobladores. Cuando tiene un tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbol con sus vecinos y amigos de su barrio y también aprovecha para disfrutar uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual son los “Tallarines Rojos”. Solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Ingeniería mecánica.

Con mucho entusiasmo Tany sale a trabajar diariamente en su negocio como  chofer de de mototaxi; trabaja alrededor de  10 horas y puede atender hasta 40 clientes en el día, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable y respetuoso.

Tany está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva porque gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mantenimiento a su vehículo y así tener un vehículo en buen estado para seguridad de el y de los clientes, asimismo podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una tienda”.
texts.en:
Tany is an enthusiastic and hardworking young man.  He and his partner have 2 precious children together who are 4 and 2 years old. They adore them and they are their reason for living and the driving force behind their daily life to be better for them. 
Their housing is located in the district of Parcona which is known for the Bosque de Piedras [Stone Forest] which are agglomerations of hills in the form of animals, and people, among others, and is also known for its agriculture and for the friendliness of its people. When he has free time he likes to play soccer with his neighbors and friends from his area, and also takes advantage of enjoying one of his favorite dishes such as Tallarines Rojos [homestyle Peruvian spaghetti in red sauce]. He only attended secondary education but would have liked to study mechanical engineering. 

Tany leaves for work enthusiastically every day in his business as a motorcycle taxi driver. He works around 10 hours and he can assist up to 40 clients a day. He thinks that his business is going well because he is very friendly and respectful. 

Tany is very happy with the Kiva loaners because thanks to the help that has been given to him he can maintain his vehicle and thus have a vehicle in good condition for his own security and his customer’s security and also he can better his income and continue fighting in order to obtain his biggest dream: to have his own store.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Charito

texts.es:
Charito es una mujer de 35 años de edad, estado civil conviviente y con 02 hijos, Vive  en casa  propia  con su cónyuge y sus hijos. La casa está ubicada en el Caserío Jesús Maria  del distrito de Tambogrande y cuenta con servicio de luz, el lugar es una comunidad  de aproximadamente 120 familias.
La actividad que desarrolla Charito  es la crianza de animales menores (ovinos, caprinos porcinos y aves de corral), lo cual lo comercializa en el mercado local. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 3 años aproximadamente; es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Así mismo se dedica a la venta de comida en su domicilio y cuenta con clientes sólidos.
El monto del crédito solicitado   es de 2000 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán para invertir en la compra de insumos para la preparación de comida, y compra de alimento para engorde y vitaminas para sus animales,  lo cual le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Charito is a 35 year old woman with a spouse and two children.  She lives in her own house with her spouse and children.  The house is located in Caserío Jesús María in Tambogrande District and it has electricity.  The place is a community of approximately 120 families.

The activity Charito does is raising small farm animals (sheep, goats, pigs and barnyard fowl) to sell in the local market.  She’s been in this occupation for approximately 3 years; that is to say she knows the line of work to perfection.  She also sells food at home and has regular customers.

The amount of the requested loan is 2000 new soles to buy ingredients for meal preparation and to buy animal feed and vitamins for her animals which will allow her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food and to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Benito Ramon

texts.es: Benito  Ramón  este emprendedor tiene un negocio joyería que consisten en la elaboración  y venta de prendas de oro y plata de diferentes estilos está ubicado en la en su casa de habitación, el Sr inicio el negocio como herencia de su ´papá la cual la ha podido mantener y hacerla rentable y productiva en la actualidad su demanda ha crecido gracias al apoyo que fundación león 2000 le ha brindado ha podido cumplir metas y objetivo como es ver crecer su herramienta de trabajo, el dinero lo necesita para invertir en la compra de materiales como : oro, plata, alambre de aluminio de diferente colores, paños exhibidores de joyas, pulidoras entre
texts.en: Benito Ramón is an entrepreneur; he has a jewelry business consisting in making and selling gold and silver items in assorted styles.  It’s located at home.  He started the business as an inheritance from his father and he’s managed to keep it going and to make it productive and profitable.  Demand has increased lately.  Thanks to the support he’s gotten from Fundación León 2000 he’s been able to reach his goals and objectives like to see his work tools increase.  He needs the money to buy materials like gold, silver, aluminum wire in assorted colors, jewelry display cloth and polishers, among others.

loans.use: to buy jewelry making supplies.

loans.name: Mirza

texts.en:
Mirza is 58 years old. He lives in Khoni District, West Georgia with his mother and 18-year-old niece. Mirza is busy with his small-scale family agricultural business. In particular, he runs a family-owned dairy farm. He has two milk cows and produces cheese, which he sells locally to dairy product retailers. According to the local government estimations, the family lives under the poverty line and they receive relevant social assistance on a monthly basis. The total average monthly income of the family is 270 Laris, including the social assistance. 

Mirza requested credit to start up a trade business. He will purchase fruits and vegetables in East Georgia for wholesale prices and then sell them on Khoni and Martvili open markets. According to Mirza’s estimations, the business will be profitable, as he has good contacts with East Georgian farmers and can get quality products for convenient prices. Little by little Mirza will expand the trade business through increasing turnover.

Mirza's loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to low income. As a result of this initiative, the living conditions of the family will significantly improve and in the future the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is 28 years old, married and has two children attending school. Elsa has a business selling home products to the people in her village. From this, she is able to provide daily allowances for her children. She hopes to improve her sales so she is now asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy air freshener, fabric conditioner, toilet bowl cleaner and soap to sell. Elsa hopes to keep extending good customer service so that she will earn profits from her business to use for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy air freshener, fabric conditioner, toilet bowl cleaner and soap to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 52 years old and married with 2 children.

Lucia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Lucia has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Lucia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Von

texts.en: Von is 52 years old. She is a mother of three children and resides with her husband in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has been involved growing rice and fattening up cattle for more than twenty years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $3 per day. In order to improve her family’s finance, Von is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase rice to resale for a profitable price. By doing so, she would generate more income to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase rice to resale for a profitable price

loans.name: Hen

texts.en:
This borrower’s name is Hen. She is 30 years old and has been a client of HKL for nearly three years. This will be her third loan that she has applied to better her family’s situation. She is married with two lovely young kids who are still students and need daily allowances. Hen and her husband are in the same business. They act as local farm laborers, working and planting crops for other villagers to generate their income. Together, they are able to generate a suitable income of USD 5.00 per day. 

Due to the lack of funds to fix her house, Hen would like to acquire a loan from HKL to purchase zinc to tile her roof and buy timber for this construction as well. In the following months, Hen plans to buy piglets to raise for additional income.

loans.use: to purchase zinc to tile her roof and buy timber for this construction as well.

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydiah is a 27-year-old single lady. She has a salon business and has been in the business for one year now. She earns a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy beauty products. In the future she wants to diversify her business to farming.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is 51 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are in school. For the past seven years, Anabelle has been raising pigs in the Philippines. She has borrowed 17 previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business.

Anabelle is requesting a 27,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 31 years old and single. She works very hard to provide for her family. For the past five  years, Michelle has run a general store in the Philippines where she sells a variety of items such as sugar, milk, coffee, soap, canned goods and other items.

Michelle is requesitng a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Antonia Angelica

texts.es:
Antonia, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo para surtir el negocio de ropa nueva, comprara blusas, faldas, pantalones, para poder mantener surtido el negocio, atender la demanda de los clientes, y que sus ventas se mantengan.
Ella considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo a tener más inventario y variedad para el negocio, sus circunstancias han cambiado mejorando para su familia.
texts.en: Antonia decided on a new loan to stock her business with new clothes; she will buy blouses, skirts and pants to keep her business stocked and meet customer demand so that her sales will remain steady.  She feels that the previous loan helped her to have more inventory and variety for her business.  Her family circumstances have changed for the better.

loans.use: to buy new clothes.

loans.name: Inocente Jackelina

texts.es:
Inocente de 48 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene hace 12 años atrás criadero y venta de pollos en la parte lateral de su casa. Realiza su trabajo todos los días, dándole de comer a los pollos y después escogiéndolos para ver cuál es el mejor para vender. 
Vende los pollos después de escogerlos por libra. Le gusta mucho su negocio por eso quiere agrandarlo más. Con el préstamo quiere comprar pollos para criarlos y realizar el proceso de comercialización con ellos.
texts.en: Inocente, 48, is a hardworking woman who has had a chicken nursery to sell chickens in her side yard for 12 years.  She works every day feeding the chicks and then choosing the ones that are best to sell.  Once she chooses them she sells them by the pound.  She likes her business very much and this is why she wants to enlarge it more.  She wants to use the loan to buy chicks to raise and then sell.

loans.use: to buy chicks.

loans.name: Guillermo Antonio

texts.es:
Guillermo, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, con la intensión de invertir en su negocio de la venta de cocos, pues comprara una cierta cantidad de cocos para mantenerlos para la venta, con lo que espera seguir manteniendo la preferencia de muchos clientes.
Él ha tenido un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior aumentándole las utilidades en el negocio, aun continua ofreciendo en temporadas flores artificiales, ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Guillermo has opted for a new loan aiming at investing in his coconut business; he will buy a certain amount of coconuts to sell which he hopes will lead to his customers continuing to prefer him.

His previous loan had a positive effect in that it increased business profits for him.   He still continues to sell artificial flowers occasionally helping his family.

loans.use: to buy coconuts.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en: Violet is a 35-year-old hard working lady living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her personal goal is to educate her children up to the university level. She has been selling fresh foods for the last three years. Her major hardships are inadequate capital to purchase stock and the short shelf life of her products. However, she has a vision of diversifying her business to include farming. Violet needs a loan to buy bananas for sell.

loans.use: to buy more bananas for sale.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en: Jenalyn is 24 years old and married with 2 children, 1 of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jenalyn has operated a sari-sari store in the Philippines for 4 years. Jenalyn requested a loan of PHP 20,000 through Kiva's partner, NWTF, to purchase more items like noodles, soft drinks, groceries etc. to sell in her store. In the future, Jenalyn would like to save enough to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like noodles, soft drinks, groceries etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 46 years old and married with four children. For the past five years she has been raising pigs in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from selling meat. 

Imelda is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan from NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jessiere

texts.en:
Jessiere is 33 years old and married with three children. For the past 15 years, she has been selling Avon products and she also earns an income from buying and selling gasoline and ready-to-wear clothing. Jessiere has borrowed and repaid nine previous loans from NWTF and she works hard to provide for her family.

Jessiere is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. In the future, she aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell

loans.name: Shuane

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Shuane works hard to support her family. She runs a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling gasoline and running a general store. Shuane has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF.

Shuane is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle transport business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to maintain her motorcycle

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: Francisco Jose es casado de desempeña dando clase en un colegio de su comunidad desde hace siete años, el es emprendedor responsable, trabajador con ganas de superación personal , el  está solicitando el crédito para las mejoras de sus casa ya que  son  sueños y metas que se ha propuesto esto lo ha podido cumplir gracias al financiamiento que fundación león 2000 le ha brindado para poder hacer la compra de materiales como: zinc, cemento, cal, pintura, madera, entre otros.
texts.en:
Francisco José is married.  He has worked teaching classes in a school in his community for seven years.  He’s a responsible, hardworking entrepreneur with a wish for personal self-improvement.

He’s asking for the loan to do some home improvements because that’s his dream and his goal that he’s set for himself and he’s been able to reach them thanks to the financing Fundación León has provided to buy materials like metal sheeting, cement, lime powder, paint and lumber, among others.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Nicolasa Emperatriz

texts.es: Nicolasa Emperatriz es una emprendedora que se le ha apoyado en el financiamiento  para invertir en el negocio para la compra de productos para la panadería en el cual ha aprovechado al máximo ya que ha aumentado su inversión para ofrecerles a sus clientes una variedad de pan, esta emprendedora toda su vida ha trabajado para sacar a su familia  adelante, durante el financiamiento a demostrado ser una persona responsable y con deseos de superación, actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para invertir en el negocio para la compra de productos como huevos, levaduras, harina, mantequilla, queso entre otros productos para la elaboración del pan.
texts.en:
Nicolasa Emperatriz is an entrepreneur who has sought support through financing to invest in her business buying products for the bakery which she’s taken advantage of to the maximum in that she has increased her investment to offer her customers a variety of bread.  This entrepreneur has worked her entire life to move her family forward and during the loan period showed herself to be a responsible person with the desire for self-improvement.

She’s currently asking for financing to invest in the business purchasing products like eggs, yeast, flour, butter and cheese among other products used to make bread.

loans.use: to buy bread baking ingredients.

loans.name: Aynura

texts.ru: Айнуре 30 лет,  воспитывает двух детей. В 2000 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи,  Айнура начала свой бизнес в торговле мясом и мясными продуктами со стартовой суммой в 5,000 сом (KGS).  Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Айнура сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  в 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях  закупа партии мясных продуктов для перепродажи, Айнура обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS).  Доходы от кредита Айнура планирует вложить  в развитие бизнеса за счет открытия небольшого цеха - бойни.
texts.en: Aynura is 30 years old, she is raising two children. In 2000, while looking for a source of income for her family, Aynura launched her own business selling meat and meat products with an initial sum of 5,000 som (KGS). With dedication and hard work, Aynura was able to develop her business so that it currently earns 20,000 som (KGS). In order to broaden an assortment of meat products, Aynura has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS). She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further development of her business by starting a small abattoir.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of meat products

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en:
Socorro is married and works hard to support her family. She runs a business selling frozen food products in the Philippines. Socorro has been in this business for seven years.

Socorro is requesting a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more ingredients for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her business

loans.name: Jeremie

texts.en:
Jeremie is 29 years old and single. For the past two years, he has been selling used shoes.

Jeremie is requesting a loan to buy more shoes to sell. He will use the profits from his loan to build a house. In the future, he would love to see his business expand.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is 21 years old and single. She has eight brothers and sisters.

Manal is a university student majoring in physics. She is paying her own school expenses. Recently she faced a financial obstacle and for that reason, she has applied for this loan so she can pay for her semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees.

loans.name: Zubeda

texts.en: Zubeda is a forty-nine-year-old woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She used the previous loan to buy used clothing to sell and with the proceeds she has been able to renovate her house and restock her business. Her major hardship is inadequate capital to purchase stock. She has a personal goal of educating her children, and a business goal of buying land to grow crops. Zubeda intends to buy clothes to sell with the loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: San Luis De Cumbe  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal San Luís de Cumbe está formado por 8 socias y 3 socios quienes laboran diariamente en distintas actividades económicas las misma que le permiten aportar a la economía de sus hogares, laboran en diferentes actividades como la agricultura, comercio y cría de animales, muchos laboran en la ciudad. Viven por la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, este lugar es de clima frió, su estructura arquitectónica se mezcla entre lo moderno y antiguo, la naturaleza del sector nos saca del ruido de la ciudad haciéndonos vivir momentos de paz y tranquilidad, su gente aun mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. 

Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la Señora. Rosa María, tiene 53 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos quienes son todos mayores de edad, 3 de ellos son casados y viven independientes,  2 son solteros y trabajan para solventar sus gastos personales. Su esposo labora en la agricultura, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Doña Rosa María pasa en casa realizando los quehaceres de su hogar y su negocio es la cría de animales como: cuyes, aves, cerdos, ganado y borregos los que vende en su comunidad. También trabaja en la agricultura y sus cosechas son para su consumo. 

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca.

Su meta es tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
The “San Luis de Cumbe” communal bank is composed of 8 female and 3 male members who work in a variety of economic activities making it possible for them to contribute to their home’s economies.  They work in different activities like agriculture, commerce and animal husbandry; many work in the city.  They live in Cumbe Parish in Cuenca.  This is a cold climate place; its architectural structure blends the modern with the ancient and nature in the sector takes us out of the city’s noise letting us live moments of peace and tranquility.  Its residents still maintain the culture and traditions of its peoples.

One of the group members is Rosa María.  She’s 53 years old, married and has five children who are all now adults.  Three of them are married and live on their own and two are single and work to cover their personal expenses.  Her husband works in agriculture and the house she lives in is her property.

Rosa María stays home doing household chores and her business is raising animals like guinea pigs, fowl, pigs, cattle and sheep that she sells in her community.  She also works in agriculture and her crops are for her own consumption.

She’s in her second loan with the communal bank and she will use it to buy a cow.  Her goal is to have a home-based store.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Juana Doribel

texts.es: Juana Doribel  tiene 47 años de edad  esta emprendedora tiene como  actividad  una  pulpería. Hace más de 2 años que tiene este negocio, ubicada en su vivienda pues con mucha ayuda de su esposo y empeño propio ha progresado, ella ha obtenido muchas experiencias y todas le han enseñado cosas muy importantes. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como golosinas, detergentes, granos básicos, refrescos y jugos, ella ha  podido mantener el negocio gracias al apoyo que fundación león 2000 le ha brindado.
texts.en:
Juana Doribel, 47, is an entrepreneur whose activity is a grocery store.  She’s had the business for more than 2 years; it’s located at home and it’s made progress thanks to help from her husband and her own efforts.  She has gained much experience that has taught her very important things.

The loan is to buy raw materials like snacks, detergent, basic grains, soft-drinks and juice.  She’s managed to stay in business thanks to support she’s gotten from Fundación León 2000.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Fathiya

texts.en:
Fathiya, 50 years old, is married and has six daughters and three sons.

Four months ago, Fathiya established a small food store in the neighborhood to help her husband and the family financially. She also added a few shelves to sell some types of detergents that are used at home.
 
Now, Fathiya has applied for this loan to buy more food products to have a variety in what she sells.

loans.use: to buy more food products

loans.name: Fayza

texts.en:
Fayza, 21 years old, is married. Her husband is serving in the military and they have a baby girl.

Fayza is also a university student majoring in childcare and education. She hopes that after graduation she can find a job to help her husband improve their living conditions before having more kids. 

She has applied for this loan so she can pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Diomedes

texts.en:
Diomedes works in an agricultural business, particularly raising hogs. He has been involved in this kind of business for two years. Currently, he is raising three sows and three hogs for fattening. He really loves his work and is always seeking to develop it by providing the daily maintenance of his raised hogs. Aside from raising hogs, he also sells livestock feed to have an extra income to cover all their daily needs and other household expenses. He aims to send his youngest child to a higher level of education in order to find better opportunities in life. To make his dreams realized, he would like to ask for financial support amounting to PHP 12,000 which will be used to buy more stock of feed and vaccines for his agricultural business.

Diomedes knows that his dreams will be obtained because he has trust in himself and in our Almighty God.

loans.use: to buy more stock of feed and vaccines for his agricultural business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, supplies and to pay day laborers.

loans.name: Damaso Edrulfo

texts.es: Damaso de 44 años, es un hombre trabajador que tiene muchas aspiraciones en su Panadería ya que hace años con esfuerzo y dedicación pudo variar más la sus panes y dulces. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 16h00 hasta las 23:00pm todos los días, haciendo panes y dulces. Cada pan ahora los vende a $ 0.07 c/u, vende tortas a un valor de $ 15.00. Tiene muchas aspiraciones en su negocio por eso quiere mejorar sus ventas y comprar con el préstamo harina, mantequilla, bebidas y otros insumos para hacer panes.
texts.en: Damaso, 44, is a hardworking man who has great hopes for his bakery since years ago with effort and dedication he was able to diversify his baked goods and sweets.  He currently works from 4pm until 11pm every day making bread and sweets.  He sells each piece of bread for $0.07 and sells cakes for $15.00.  He has many hopes for the business and this is why he wants to improve sales and to use the loan to buy flour, butter, soft-drinks and other ingredients to make bread.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter and eggs.

loans.name: Najmah

texts.en:
Najmah is 44 years old and married. She has five sons and daughters.

It has been eight years since she started her own small business at home, but it is growing slowly as she did not have enough money to finance it in the beginning. She started by selling clothes and then started selling blankets too. 

Now she wants to add selling lighter weight covers and get a new spring and summer clothes collection to sell. For that reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy lighterweight blankets to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala east region of Uganda. He is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Joseph has been working hard to manage his retail shop where he sells sugar, soap and pants. 

To help expand his business, Joseph has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like soap and salt for resale and will help Joseph to generate greater profits and educate his children. Joseph hopes that in the future, he will be able to grow his business. 

Joseph is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joseph who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like soap, salt to sell

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling vegetables business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell for her buying and selling vegetables business.

Rosalinda has been in this business for five years. Rosalinda earns more income from food vending and a general store.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 25 years old. She is single. She sells shoes for both ladies and men and she has spent four years in the business. The loan will be used to buy more shoes to sell. She plans to use the profits to save for a better future.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Martha Olanda

texts.es: Martha de 51 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene un negocio de comida. Comenzó su negocio desde el 2008 ya que vio que el sector no había ese tipo de negocio. En la actualidad trabaja por pedidos y la ayuda su hija cocinando la comida. Tiene muchas aspiraciones de seguir con su negocio de realizar comidas por pedios de almuerzo. Por tal necesita el préstamo para compara víveres para realizar la comida como frutas, granos, vegetales, verduras etc.
texts.en: Martha, 51, is a hardworking woman who has a food business.  She started it in 2008 seeing that there was no similar business in her sector.  She currently works based on prior orders and her daughter helps her cook the food.  She has many hopes to continue growing in her business making meals on order for lunch.  Because of this she needs a loan to buy foodstuffs like fruit, grains and vegetables, etc. to make the meals.

loans.use: to buy fruit, grains and vegetables.

loans.name: Chhuon

texts.en:
Chhuon is 36 years old and married to a farmer. They have four single children, one of whom is employed while the other three children are still students. They live together in Pouk district, Siem Reap province. Chhuon raises hogs while her husband manages their rice farming business. Despite the hardship of living, she aims to improve her hog-raising business to increase her income and satisfy their needs. 

Chhuon wants to build a proper wooden pigpen to protect her pigs and keep them healthy.  Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan to build a pigpen and buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. She mentioned that the loan will help her improve the business and hopes that she will be successful in managing the business.

loans.use: to build a pigpen and buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Erneste

texts.en: Erneste is 40 years old. He has owned a store for four years. He wants the loan to buy juice, sodas, and milk to sell. With the profits, he plans to buy a car, which will ease his means of transport.

loans.use: To buy more juice, sodas and milk to sell in his store.

loans.name: Sophanny

texts.en: Sophanny is 40 years old. She is a mother of two children and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman who earns about $8 per day. One of her children is a construction worker. He earns about $3 per day. Due to the difficulty of the family’s living conditions, Sophanny is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the money saved on her transportation expenses to support her family. In the future, she would like to run a tailoring shop and help her children earn Bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a 46-year-old woman. She is married and has five grown up children who attend school.

She has worked as a retailer for three years. She sells basic food products to all types of customers at her shop. She buys her products in town. She works hard with the help of her husband. At the moment, her main difficulty is being unable to satisfy all the demands of her customers. 

She has requested her loan from ASKI in order to buy basic food products. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the coming years, Imelda would like to expand the size of her business. She says that with the profits, she intends to ensure her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy spices, beverages and canned goods for her store

loans.name: Theophile

texts.en: Theophile is 23 years old. He rides a motorbike as a means of providing transport to others. He has been riding bikes for five years. With the loan, he will make repairs on the motorbike in order to get better earnings for the future. He plans to buy a plot of land from the profits he will gain from the business.

loans.use: To maintain and repair his motorbike

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a married woman from Andabuen. She began working with her husband to create a monthly income for herself and her family many years ago. Originally, she sold bread made over an open fire pit. She is expanding her business activity and introducing bread made in their village. This will allow her to increase her supply and meet demands from her customers. The business is located in her home and draws clients with her fresh and delicious bread.

Elena needs her loan to purchase special bread-making supplies and materials.

Elena wants to continue to provide an even better income for her family and draw clients from throughout the area.

loans.use: to buy flour and yeast for her business

loans.name: Pascasie

texts.en: Pascasie is 26 years old and she sells sweaters, trousers, and shirts. She has been in the business for seven years. With the loan, she wants to buy more sweaters since it is the rainy season. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more sweaters to sell

loans.name: Walter Jeovanni

texts.es:
Walter, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, para seguir trabajando en su taller de estructuras metálicas  y de bicicletas, él comprara hierro, láminas, chapas, repuestos varios para bicicletas, esto le ayudara para mantener surtido el negocio y poder realizar los trabajos a los clientes.
El manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le ayudo mucho, pues pudo obtener mejores beneficios en su trabajo,  cancelo rapidamente con la intencion de invertir más, tambien sus condiciones económicas son mejores.
texts.en:
Walter has decided to request a new loan, to continue working in his bicycle and metal structure repair shop.  He will buy iron, plates, sheets and various bicycle parts. This will help him to keep the business well-stocked and be able to carry out jobs for his clients.  

He expresses that the previous loan helped him a lot, he was able to obtain better profits from his work and paid it off quickly with the intention of investing more. His economic conditions are also better.

loans.use: to buy iron, plates, sheets and various bicycle parts.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella works hard to support her family. Estrella is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Estrella requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the repair and maintenance of her motorcycle.

Estrella has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Estrella would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to repair and maintain her motorcycle

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en:
Gaudiosa is 50 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Gaudiosa is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Gaudiosa has been raising pigs for five years and earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college. This is her second loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Load

texts.en: Load is 42 years old. She is a mother of two children and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling Khmer noodle for more than three years, earning approximately USD $4 per day. Her husband is a policeman who earns about $3 per day. One of her children is a garment worker who earns about $3 per day. Due to the difficulty with her family’s transportation, Load is requesting a loan of $625 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the money saved on her transportation expenses to support her family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home and help her youngest child earn a Bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Serblin

texts.en:
Serblin is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children.

For the past two years, Serblin has been running a grocery store, which has been a profitable project but not enough to cover all her expenses.

She is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan from ASKI to help her cover the cost of purchasing a variety of products and groceries to sell, such as rice, milk, sugar, and cooking oil. This will enable Serblin to offer customers all the types of groceries they often request and buy. This will increase sales and improve the family's income.

Serblin's photo was taken inside her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy rice, milk, sugar, and cooking oil

loans.name: Aura Lidia

texts.es: Aura es originaria de Estelí, de 61 años de edad, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de ropa interior actividad en la que lleva 30 años de experiencia, madre de una hija de vida independiente. Aura ya ha trabajado con crédito otorgado por nuestra institución el cual lo utilizo para la compra de ropa interior y plástico el que ayudo económicamente ya que invirtió mas en el negocio, hoy solicita otro préstamo al igual para compra de ropa interior y utensilios plástico ya que este le ayudara  con la compra de mas variedades de ropa interior que podrá ofrecerle a su clientela, en el negocio recibe el apoyo de su hija. Sus planes futuros es seguir trabajando con créditos hasta hacer crecer su negocio para tener mejores oportunidades de vida y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en: Aura is a native of Esteli.  She is 61 years old and works in retail trade selling underwear.  She has 30 years of experience in this line of work.  She has a daughter who is independent.  Aura has already taken a loan from our institution, which she used to buy underwear and plastic items.  This helped her financially because she was able to invest more in her business.  Now she is requesting another loan, which she will also use to buy underwear and plastic utensils.  This will help her to purchase a greater variety of underwear to offer to her customers.  Her daughter supports her with her business.  In the future, Aura plans to continue to take loans so that her business will grow and she will have better life opportunities and get ahead with her family.

loans.use: to buy underwear and plastic utensils

loans.name: Shakhabadkhan

texts.ru:
Шахабадхан 58 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Шахабадхан на протяжении 27 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес практически с нуля. Благодаря упорному труду Шахабадхан в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется корова с теленком, 1 бычок, и 0,81 га земли, где она выращивает кукурузу.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Шахабадхан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дойных коров, что позволит ей увеличить надои.  Доходы от кредита Шахабадхан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Shakhabadkhan is fifty-eight years old, married and has four children. More than twenty-seven years ago, she started her business of animal raising from scratch. Thanks to hard work and dedication, Shakhabadkhan now boasts a cow, a calf, a bull and 0,81 hectares of land used for planting corn. 

In hope of expanding her business, she approached "Bai Tushum and Partners", requesting a loan of 100,000 soms (KGS) in order to purchase a pair of milking cows which will allow her to increase her milk production twofold. Shakhabadkhan is planning to reinvest profits from the loan into her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Edrina

texts.en:
Edrina is 65 years old and widowed with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. Edrina runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her store.
Edrina has borrowed and paid back 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from house rentals. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 50 years old and married with five children. With one child in school, she works very hard to provide for them.
Divina runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 18,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.
Divina has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, detergent, spices and other groceries. In the future she would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Fabiola Alexandra

texts.es: En Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas podemos ver a Fabiola, una joven de 21 años, madre soltera quien hace dos años inició su negocio. Santo Domingo, una ciudad con historia, mucha diversidad y bastante comercio alrededor. La diversidad de las culturas en el centro que conviven para darles alegría a las personas que caminan por ahí. Fabiola ha comenzado una oportunidad a través de la venta de productos de belleza para poder tener mejores ingresos en su familia. Su  hijo va a la escuela y su mayor anhelo es que continúe sus estudios y que siga poco a poco superándose para que tenga un mejor futuro. El esfuerzo que ella hace todos los días para que su negocio crezca se refleja en los resultados de su bebe. El obstáculo más grande que ha tenido hasta ahora ha sido la falta de capital, por lo que la inversión que ahora realizará se verá directamente reflejada en su negocio. Ella espera que con el crecimiento de su negocio, todas las metas y sueños de su familia puedan cumplirse. Anhelamos entonces que las metas de Fabiola se cumplan.
texts.en: In Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas we can see Fabiola, a 21 years old young woman, single mother, who started her business two years ago. Santo Domingo is a city with history, lots of diversity and plenty of commerce around it. The diversity of the cultures that live together in the center of the city give joy to the people who walk by. Fabiola saw an opportunity in the sale of beauty products in order to be able to have a better income in her family. Her son goes to school, and her biggest wish is that he continues studying and continues bettering himself so that he can have a better future. The effort she puts in every day to make her business grow is now reflected on her baby's results. The biggest obstacle she has had so far has been the lack of capital, which is why the investment she will now make will be directly reflected on her business. She hopes that with the growth of her business, all her family's goals and dreams will come true. So, Fundación Alternativa yearns for Fabiola's goals to be accomplished.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products to resell

loans.name: Daysi Narcisa

texts.es: Daysi de 65 años de edad es originaria de Granada, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de leña y frijoles cocidos desde hace 7 años, realizo estudios hasta el segundo grado de primaria. Inicio su actividad vendiendo frijoles cocidos, luego fue invirtiendo en la compra de leña con dinero que le dio el esposo anteriormente ella trabajaba lavando y planchando a domicilio hoy en día saca su negocio adelante por si misma, cuenta con otros ingresos ya que se ayuda con el alquiler de un cuarto, sus expectativas son crecer y implementar con nuevos productos como venta de queso y huevo. Realiza el préstamo para invertir en compra de leña para estar preparada para el invierno el cual estima le ayudara ya que por la época de lluvia se escasea la leña y se pone mas cara, como planes futuros espera hacer que su negocio cuente con productos variados como leña, frijoles, alimentos perecederos con el objetivo de obtener mayores ganancias para poder hacerle mejora a su vivienda.
texts.en: Daysi, who is 65 years old, is from Granada, she has been selling firewood and baked beans for a living for 7 years. She completed her studies up to the second year of elementary school. She started her baked beans selling activity, then she began investing in the purchase of firewood with money her husband gave to her. Previously she worked washing and ironing clothes door-to-door. Nowadays she keeps her business going on her own. She depends on additional sources of income, since she helps support herself renting a room. Her expectations are to grow and to sell new products such as cheese and eggs. She requests the loan in order to invest in purchasing firewood so that she is ready for the winter, which she estimates will be helpful for her since during the rainy weather time of the year, the wood is scarce and gets more expensive. As a plan for her future she hopes her business can offer a variety of products such as wood, beans and perishable goods, with the aim of getting higher revenues in order to be able to make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to purchase firewood

loans.name: Alejandro José

texts.es:
El joven Alejandro José es originario del municipio de El Sauce, es un joven luchador y comprometido con su familia ya que es casado por lo que siempre se ha dedicado al comercio para llevar el sustento a dicho hogar.
Su negocio consiste en un Taller de bicicletas en el cual vende repuestos para las mismas ubicado en su vivienda donde tiene varios años de tenerlo y donde en dicho municipio es bien conocido por su amabilidad y honradez.
Es el cuarto crédito que solicita en Ceprodel con el fin de invertirlo en el negocio para la compra de rines, llantas, neumáticos, balineras, cadenas y selectores, ya que actualmente su demanda es mayor  y con el capital que cuenta no abastece estas solicitudes de sus clientes.
Espera que le apoyen con esta solicitud para satisfacer su demanda y así generar más ingresos con el fin de cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar y llegar a construir su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Young Alejandro Jose is a native of El Sauce.  He is a tenacious youth who is committed to his family because he is married.  He has always worked in retail trade to support his household.

His business is a bicycle workshop where he sells spare parts for bikes.  His workshop is located in his house, which is where he has had the business for a number of years.  In his town, he is well known for his friendliness and honesty.

This is the 4th loan that he has requested from Ceprodel.  He will invest the money in his business, purchasing rims, tires, inner tubes, ball bearings, chains and gear selectors, because the demand for his products is increasing and he can't keep up with it with the capital he has on hand.  He hopes that with the support of this loan, he will be able to satisfy his customer's demands and in this way generate more income so that he can cover all of his household expenses and eventually build his own home.

loans.use: to buy bicycle rims, tires, inner tubes, ball bearings, chains and gear selectors

loans.name: Nzara

texts.en:
Nzara is a mother of eight children, all of whom are attending school. She is married to Jira, a teacher. 
Nzara operates both a poultry and tailoring business and has been doing so for the last 20 years. She also operates a grounding machine as a side job. Nzara owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She dreams of hiring employees in the future. 
Nzara joined Kiva partner Yehu to get cheap loans. With this 50,000 KES loan, she intends to buy chicken feed and chicks.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and chicks.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is 35 years old, married and has three children who currently going to school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.
Deborah buys and sells recycled materials in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy more recycled materials to sell.
Deborah has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en: Now, Feliciana is borrowing 17,000 PHP to fund her livestock business, which has been previously funded through Kiva partner NWTF. This loan will help Feliciana to continue to provide for her family and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell.

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida is a 47-year-old married woman and mother of eleven children. Saida is a hardworking woman, a loving and caring mother, who never feels tired from anything.

Saida's name means Happy, and her name describes her very well. She's always smiling and happy even in her hard times.
With a big family, she shared responsibilities with her beloved husband two years ago when she opened her small grocery store.
Saida's store is improving but needs external support to increase its capital. That's why she applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy products for the special offers necessary to attract new customers and to increase her income.

Saida hopes to do necessary decoration and  maintenance to her store in the future and to expand to a wider one soon.

loans.use: To increase her business capital to offer special products

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
