Sarah is 30 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. Sarah works hard to manage her retail shop, which sells goods such as sugar and soap. 
To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from Kiva partner BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities, such as soap and salt, for resale, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and increase her capital. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to own a wholesale shop. 
Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sarah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities, such as soap and salt, for resale.

loans.name: Oscar Leonel

texts.es: El señor Oscar, originario de la comunidad Mata Palo, Estelí, de oficio agricultor. Dice que después del primer préstamo obtenido en Kiva, le ha ayudado a ir mejorando en sus siembras pues su primer crédito lo utilizo para comprar insumos para sembrar tomates, de los cuales obtuvo una buena producción. Esta solicitando nuevamente este crédito para la compra de insumos y pago de  mano de obra para sembrar ½ manzana de tomate. El espera sacar muy buenos rendimiento y calidad para vender a un precio que le permita seguir mejorando sus cultivos y ampliar las áreas de siembra. Pero lo más importante para él es trabajar cada día para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, que junto con el lucha por salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sr. Oscar is originally from the community of Mata Palo, Estelí, and is a farmer by trade. After he received his first Kiva loan, Oscar said that his crops improved because he used the funds to buy supplies for growing tomatoes. He was able to obtain a good level of production.

Oscar is requesting another loan so that he can buy supplies and pay for labor. He intends to plant a half plot of tomatoes. Oscar hopes to achieve a good yield and quality so that he can sell his products at a price that will help him to improve his crops and expand his farmland. However, the most important thing for Oscar is to work each day to provide a better quality of life for his family. He strives to press forward toward this goal.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and pay for labor.

loans.name: Basilia Bertila

texts.es:
Basilia tiene 60 años es una mujer muy entusiasta y trabajadora, con un espíritu y alegría de una joven de 20, junto a ella viven 2 sobrinas a las cuales quiere mucho como si fueran sus hijas, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener uno de los atractivos turísticos más importantes del país, el cual son las Islas Ballestas y el candelabro de Paracas, así como también playas hermosas. Con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro Basilia logro tener su negocio de venta de venta de abarrotes, desde hace ya 5 años, al principio le fue un poco difícil pero con el pasar de los días aprendió mucho,  es muy paciente y por ello ella cree que le va bien en el negocio además  ser amable con los clientes.

Basilia está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar una mejorar en su vivienda y también comprar mercadería para su negocio como Arroz, azúcar, bebidas gaseosas, entre otros; así ella podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando para seguir adelante y cumplir su más grande sueño:” Crecer en su negocio”.
texts.en:
Basilia, 60, is a very enthusiastic and hard-working woman with the spirit and joy of a 20-year-old. She lives with two nieces that she loves very much, as if they were her own daughters. She lives in the city of Pisco, which has two of Peru’s main touristic attractions: Ballestas Islands and the Paracas Chandelier, as well as many beautiful beaches. With much effort and savings, Basilia achieved to start her own grocery-selling business 5 years ago. It was a bit hard for her in the beginning but as the days went by she learned a lot. She is very patient and that is why she thinks she does well, besides being kind to her customers. 

Basilia is very thankful to Kiva loaners because thanks to their help she will be able to make some house improvements and buy some goods for her business such as rice, sugar and soda drinks, among others. Thus, she will be able to improve her quality of life and her income and keep on working and moving on in order to achieve her greatest dream: to see her business grow.

loans.use: to stock her business and make house improvements

loans.name: Jomarie

texts.en:
Jomarie is a 28-year-old married woman from Isabela and a mother of two children.
She has a distinguished home-based business fattening pigs to sell in the future. She is now requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase feed and vitamins for her business.
Jomarie is looking to improve her business so that she can increase her income and provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Nolie

texts.en:
Nolie, pictured beside the truck she plans to repair, is 48 years old and married. For the past year, she has been transporting goods, which has been  a profitable venture.
Nolie is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP from KIVA to help her cover the costs of repairing her truck, and improve and expand her work. This will enable Nolie to travel from one place to another to expand her work and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy tires and fuel for her business.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is 46 years of age and married to Claudio who is retired from the air force.
Amelia has a small store where she sells different kinds of merchandise such as cooking oil, beverages, biscuits, sugar, spices and other basic goods. Her main objective in starting the business was to provide her family with a better way of living and to educate her two children. Amelia started her general store last November. She is also engaged in the agricultural business, planting rice crops and raising hogs. Amelia would like to improve all her businesses in order to obtain a greater income to provide for her family's needs. She paid back her previous loan and is now requesting another loan of 10,000 PHP. She will use this loan to buy more stock. She hopes that through this investment she is able to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of merchandise for her general store.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 25-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. She has been working in the beauty business for six years. Zeinab specializes in tattoos and make-up. She doesn't have her own beauty salon – rather she works by appointment in her friends' hairdressing shops.
Zeinab feels that it's almost time to settle down and improve her business, since she now has a good number of customers who trust and deal with her.
Today, Zeinab is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to open her own beauty salon. The loan will help to furnish the salon and buy the necessary tools and machines to start a new business.
Zeinab is sure that she will succeed because of her talent and her customers' loyalty.

loans.use: to open her own beauty salon

loans.name: Jehova Jireth Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal Jehová Yireth está conformado por ocho emprendedores que es su primer crédito que está solicitando a Fundación León 2000, para invertir en el negocio en la compra de productos para los negocios que tiene. Este grupo son de la misma localidad y se unieron para apoyarse, su presidenta siempre los está motivando para que salgan juntos adelantes enfrentando los obstáculos que se les presente. Lillian Josafeth tiene 27 años de edad su actividad a la que se dedica es la venta de pollo este negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación, ya tiene sus cliente fijos y eventuales a quienes les ofrece la variedad de pollo, está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de pollos y poder satisfacer a sus clientes.
texts.en: The Jehová Yireth community bank members are eight entrepreneurs applying for a loan from Fundación León 2000 for the first time. They plan to use their loans to invest in their small businesses. The group members live and meet in the same town. Their president is always supportive, encouraging the members to overcome obstacles they face. Lillian Josafeth is 27 years old and runs a business from home selling poultry. She has many customers, both loyal and casual, that she sells a variety of chickens to. She is requesting financing to buy more chickens to meet her high demand.

loans.use: To invest in business activities.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
La joven Ana Julia es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, labora como oficinista en una Institución donde tiene muchos años, actividad que le ha permitido adquirir electrodomésticos para el hogar e ir mejorando su vivienda poco a poco.
Como madre responsable de sus hijos trata de darles lo mejor de sí en cariño y bienestar en el hogar con todas sus condiciones adecuadas.
Tiene dos años de trabajar con ceprodel donde le han otorgado ocho créditos para comprar electrodomésticos y para mejora de vivienda, razón por la cual agradece a esta Institución ya que gracias a ella tiene lo que hoy es su humilde hogar con el mobiliario necesario y que sin ello no hubiera podido adquirir esto porque con su bajo salario con costo alcanza para la canasta básica que es lo principal en un hogar.
Actualmente está solicitando para la compra de una lavadora con el fin de agilizar sus labores domésticos ya que tiene que agilizar su tiempo para cubrir los dos trabajos el de su hogar y el de su oficina.
texts.en:
Young Ana Julia is originally from the town of El Sauce. She has been working as an office worker at an institution for many years, an activity that has permitted her to buy electrical household appliances for the home and to improve her living conditions little by little.

As a responsible mother of her children she tries to give them the best care and wellbeing at home with adequate living conditions.

She has been working two years with Ceprodel where she has been granted 8 loans in order to buy electrical household appliances in order to improve her housing, and for this reason she is appreciative to the institution as thanks to them she has what she has in her humble home with the necessary furnishings and without it she would not have been able to acquire it because her low salary could not cover the basic living expenses of a home.

Currently she is asking for a loan in order to buy a washing machine with the goal of making her domestic chores easier to save her time between the two jobs of her house and her office work.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine

loans.name: Xiomara Del Carmen

texts.es:
Xiomara del Carmen es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se gana la vida laborando  en una Institución  donde tiene muchos años de brindarles sus servicios, labor que le permite generar sus propios ingresos y cubrir parte de los gastos que se incurren en su hogar.
Como madre responsable trata de darles lo mejor que puede a sus hijos y lo que le alcanza con su pequeño salario, por eso tiene siete años de relación con Ceprodel donde le han otorgado 13 créditos todos para beneficio de su familia y para su desarrollo económico, ya que gracias a estos financiamientos ha resuelto problemas de índole de salud, de estudios, lo que hoy agradece eternamente a esta Institución por su apoyo incondicional.
Este último crédito lo solicita para gastos médicos ya que quiere mejorar su salud para desempeñar mejor su labor de madre y en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Xiomara del Carmen was born in the municipality of El Sauce. She supports herself working in an institution where for many years she has offered her services. Xiomara's work allows her to generate her own income and cover part of the costs she incurs in her home.

As a responsible mother, Xiomara tries to offer the best she can for her children and what she can afford with her small salary. To do so, she has worked with CEPRODEL for 7 years and received 13 loans, all to benefit her family and her own economic development. Thanks to this financing, Xiomara has resolved problems with her health and education, and she will be eternally grateful to this institution for its unconditional assistance.

Xiomara is requesting this latest loan to pay her medical expenses. She wishes to improve her health in order to better carry out her work as a mother and a worker.

loans.use: pay for her medical expenses.

loans.name: Liliana Yessenia

texts.es:
EL Banco La Dolorosa que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por las extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Liliana, tiene 27 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 8, 6 y 3 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo es albañil.

Ella se dedica a la cría de  aves de corral y tiene una pequeña granja en sus casa,  en temporadas compra una gran cantidad de pollos los cuales los cría durante dos a tres meses que es el tiempo para que ya estén listos para la venta, los entrega a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa y también entrega en algunas tiendas de su localidad, lleva 2 años dedicada a esta labor y le ha ido bastante bien ya que es una forma de ganar algo de dinero sin salir de su casa.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas para los mismos. Es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos se ha ayudado mucho para salir adelante.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su vida y su negocio.
texts.en: The group El Banco La Dolorosa meets every fifteen days in the Cantón Jipijapa (a region in the province of Manabi, Ecuador). This region is known as the Sultan of Coffee due to extensive coffee producing in the area that makes a coffee that has an incomparable flavor; it is also known for its gastronomy and the warmth of its people.  Ms. Liliana lives here, she is 27 years old, married and the couple has three children who are 8, 6 and 3 years old. The two oldest  children go to school. Her husband is a bricklayer. She takes care of livestock birds and has a small farm at her house. Seasonally, she purchases a large number of chickens that she cares for for two to three months and when they are ready to sell, she sells them to traders who arrive at her house and also sells them to some local stores. She has been engaged in this activity for two years and she has done so well that she is able to earn money without needing to leave her home. This new credit will be used to purchase chickens as well as feed and medicine for them. This is her fourth time using a communal bank and she likes it because the credits have helped her to advance. It is her dream to continue to advance in life and in her business.

loans.use: purchase chickens as well as feed and medicine for them.

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en: Laurence is married with four children aged between four and eleven and all go to school. She has been selling different items in a store for four years. The loan will be used to buy cooking oil, salt, and soaps for selling. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, salt and soaps for selling.

loans.name: Philemon

texts.en: Philemon is age 26. He is a father of one child who is two years old. He sells used shoes for men and has been in this business for two years. Philemon has requested a loan to buy more shoes to sell. The profits will be used to buy a plot of land for living in the future.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.en:
Inocencia is 47 years old. She lives in Andabuen village with her husband. Four years ago, Inocencia got involved in the agricultural business. She runs a farm, where she is raising three cows and two pigs.

She has applied for this loan to develop pig breeding. With the requested loan she plans to purchase five pigs and barley and wheat to feed them.

Development of pig breeding will allow Inocencia to increase her income from agriculture, which is vital for her to insure a prosperous future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets for her business.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a 45-year-old married woman. She has nine children and two are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Mdzomba and he works as a butcher. 

Umazi operates a green grocer and sells her goods at the market. She has worked in this business for five years. Her primary customers are the general public. Her other sources of income include farming. Umazi describes her greatest business challenges as transport and competition and her highest monthly expenses are food, clothing, and school fees. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She will use the KES 25,000 loan to purchase more groceries. She joined Yehu to access loans and improve her living.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 32 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is single and has six children, four of whom are currently in school. For the past 13 years, Fatima has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells fruits. 

To help expand her business, Fatima has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fruits for resale, and will help Fatima to generate greater profits and increase her capital. Fatima hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another branch of the same business. 

Fatima is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Fatima who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more fruits for resale.

loans.name: Ketty Aracely

texts.es:
En el barrio Umiña de la ciudad de  Manta cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Umiña, ciudad conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y  por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ketty, tiene 44 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una hija de 7 años de edad la misma que estudia  en escuela. El marido trabaja en el extranjero. 

Ella con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos y con esto solventar sus gastos y los de su pequeña hija se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, joyas de plata y  productos por catálogos de Avon, y Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los días más que todo en las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos y aprovecha que su pequeña está en la escuela, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta o en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, la mercadería nos cuenta que la va a comprar a Guayaquil y también le envían del extranjero. Lleva más de 7 años en su negocio y le ha ido muy bien.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar joyas de plata, ropa,  perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y otros productos. Está desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque en las reuniones se entretiene con sus compañeras.
 
Sus sueños darle lo mejor a su pequeña y que su esposo regrese a casa.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank called "Umiña" meets every 15 days in the neighborhood of Umiña in the city of Manta. This place is known for its beautiful beaches, its food, and for being one of the largest ports in the country and in the Americas since it is situated on the Pacific.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Ketty. She is 44 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has a seven-year-old daughter who is in school. Her husband works abroad.

Ketty works to earn her own income and to provide for her young daughter's expenses. She sells clothing of all types, silver jewelry, and Avon and Yanbal products through catalogs (such as beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women's accessories). Ketty works every day, mostly in the mornings since it is easier for her to travel at that time and take advantage of the hours when her little one is at school. She sells by going door-to-door or by having customers come to her home. Ketty extends credit and collects payment every eight days. She says that she buys her products in Guayaquil, but she also has merchandise shipped from abroad. Ketty has been in business for more than seven years and has done very well.

This loan will be used to buy silver jewelry, clothing, perfumes, trinkets, cosmetics, crèmes, and other products. Ketty has been with her Communal Bank from the beginning and says that she enjoys the fact that her fellow group members keep her entertained during their meetings. Her dreams are to provide the best for her little one and to see her husband return home.

loans.use: to buy silver jewelry, clothing, perfumes, trinkets, cosmetics, crèmes, and other products.

loans.name: Rosadilla

texts.en:
Rosadilla is 45 years. She is married and lives with ten children in Isabela Province. She has been involved in animal husbandry for more than six years. 

Rosadilla is requesting a PHP 6,000 loan to improve her business and purchase piglets to breed and resell. This money will help her expand her business and increase her profit to support her family. In the future, she would like to use her profit to expand her business and help her children get their bachelors degrees. She also hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feed for her business.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en: Rukia is 26 years old. She has owned a bookstore for one year. She is single and has requested a loan to buy more books to sell. With the profits, she plans to increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy more books to sell.

loans.name: Maria Nancy

texts.es: Maria de 57 años, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil un lugar urbano que tienen mucho futuro de crecimiento municipal. Maria comenzó vendiendo productos Yanbal ya que una  amiga la llevo a una charla para comenzar como vendedora de cosméticos y perfumes. Poco a poco ha comenzado a mejorar sus ventas vendiendo perfumes, cremas, cosméticos etc. Tiene muchas aspiraciones en sus ventas por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar perfumes, cosméticos. Su sueño en unos años en ser Directora de Ventas de Yanbal.
texts.en: 57 year old Maria lives in Orquídeas de Guayaquil, an urban place that has a promising future for municipal growth. Maria began selling Yanbal products (cosmetics from a catalog) because a friend took her to a  workshop for beginners in selling cosmetics and perfumes. Little by little, she has begun to improve her sales, selling perfumes, creams, cosmetics, etc. She has many aspirations for her sales and so she wants a loan to buy perfumes and cosmetics. Her dream is to be Director of Sales for Yanbal after some years.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Rene Marciano

texts.es:
Rene es originario de Granada , de 53 años de edad, de oficio comerciante se desempeña como docente(profesor) y barbero, casado, padre de 2 hijos los cuales están a su cargo. Inicio su  actividad como barbero  atravez de la herencia que recibió de parte del abuelo y de su papa de que le heredo parte  del negocio el decidió seguir con el negocio  de barbería a la edad de 50 años contando actualmente con  2 años y medio de experiencia y dominio anteriormente trabajaba de profesor en los colegios de Granada, recibe el apoyo de sus dos hijos, sus expectativas son mantenerse en el mismo lugar donde tiene el negocio pero hacerle remodelaciones para mejores condiciones y mejorar el servicio para mayor atracción de los clientes. 
Solicita el préstamo para compra de sillas plásticas, maquinas de afeitar, tijeras,taollas etc. Todos los accesorios necesarios en una barbería, el estima que este le ayudara ya que teniendo mas remodelado el negocio con una mejor presentación atraera mas clientes que le generara mas ganancias, sus planes futuros es tener un negocio bastante moderno y llegar a ser dueño del local para dejar de alquilar.
texts.en: Rene is from Granada, he is 53 years old, and some of his professions include teaching and working as a barber. He is married and the father of two children who are both under his care. He began working as a barber after receiving an inheritance from a grandfather, and from his father who inherited part of the business, and so he decided to continue with the family trade when he was 50 years old, now giving him two years of experience and expertise. He previously worked as a teacher in the high schools in Granada. He gets help from his two children and he expects to keep the business in its current location but to do some remodeling to improve the conditions and to improve service in order to attract more clients. He is asking for a loan to buy plastic seats, shaving devices, scissors, towels -all the necessary accessories for a barber shop. He believes that this will help him because after the remodeling, the business will have a better presentation and will attract more clients, which will generate more earnings. His future plans are to have a more modern business and to become proprietor of the shop in order to be able to rent it out.

loans.use: to purchase plastic seats, shaving devices, scissors, towels etc.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
Doña María Elena habita en una comarca rural del municipio de El Sauce, su actividad comercial consiste en una pequeña pulpería desde  varios años donde abastece a la mayoría de los pobladores de productos para el hogar.
Trabaja arduamente todos los días  de la semana desde las 5 am para poder cumplir con los gastos del hogar y pagar la universidad de su única hija a la cual le quiere dejar por lo menos de herencia su preparación como profesional para que sea alguien en la vida y se defienda por sí sola.
Por ese motivo está solicitando su sexto crédito en Ceprodel porque necesita capital para invertir en productos que demandan sus clientes y que por falta del mismo no ha adquirido, para la compra de golosinas, azúcar, gas, jabón, pan y arroz.
Espera seguir trabajando con Ceprodel porque gracias a ello ha mantenido su negocio y está logrando cumplir su meta de ver a su hija preparada.
texts.en:
María Elena lives in a rural district in El Sauce municipality.  Her commercial activity consists in a small general store she’s had for several years; she supplies most of the residents with merchandise for the home.

She works hard every day of the week starting at 5am to be able to cover her household expenses and pay for her only daughter’s university; she wants to support her and leave her at least the legacy of professional preparation so that she can become someone in life and be able to fend for herself.

Because of this she’s asking for her sixth Ceprodel loan because she needs capital to invest in products her customers are requesting and because of lack thereof she’s been unable to stock.  She will buy snacks, sugar, gas, soap, bread and rice.

She hopes to continue working with Ceprodel because thanks to this she’s stayed in business and is reaching her goal of seeing her daughter prepared.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Pok

texts.en:
Pok is 49 years old. She is a mother of three children and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $5 per day. Two of her children are employed in garment factory. They earn about $7 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Pok is requesting a loan of $900 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support her family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business to earn more income to support the family and help her youngest child earn a bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible to provide better living condition for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute.

loans.name: María José

texts.es:
En el barrio Umiña de la ciudad de  Manta cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Umiña, ciudad conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y  por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico. 

En este lugar vive la señora María José, tiene  22 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una niña de 6 meses El marido es comerciante. 

Ella estudia Administración de Empresas en una universidad de la localidad, es una joven madre muy trabajadora que siempre le gusto ganarse su propio dinero y con esto solventar sus gastos tanto de estudios y ahora de su hogar, ella se dedica a la venta de de ropa y productos de Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días ya que en ratos sale a recorrer por la localidad y también les vende a sus compañeros y conocidos en la universidad donde estudia, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. La mercadería la van a comprar con su marido al Perú o le mandan también de los Estados Unidos. Tiene tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa de todo tipo y genero. Este es el cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. 

Su sueño es terminar sus estudios y ejercer su profesión.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank called "Umiña" meets every 15 days in the neighborhood of Umiña in the city of Manta. This place is known for its beautiful beaches, its food, and for being one of the largest ports in the country and in the Americas since it is situated on the Pacific.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. María José. She is 22 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has a six-month-old daughter. Her husband is a merchant.

María José is studying Business Administration at a local university. She is also a hardworking young mother who always enjoys earning her own income so that she can cover the cost of her studies and the household expenses. María José sells clothing, as well as Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women's accessories). She works every day by traveling all over town. She also sells to her classmates and acquaintances at the university where she studies. María José extends credit for her products and collects payment every eight days. She and her husband travel to Peru to buy her merchandise, but she also has items shipped in from the United States. María José has been in business for three years and has done very well.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and clothing of all types and styles. María José is in her fourth loan cycle with the Communal Bank and enjoys being a member because of the help that the loans have given her. Her dream is to finish her studies and pursue her profession.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and clothing.

loans.name: Activo De Vitarte Group

texts.es: Nancy pertenece a la alcancía comunal "Activo de Vitarte" ubicada en el distrito de Vitarte esta alcancía está conformada por 7 integrantes las cuales son mujeres con muchas ganas por salir adelante y tener éxitos en sus negocios, una de ella es Nancy de 45 años de edad, casada y con 3 hijos, dos de ellos son ya mayores de edad  y uno esta en el colegio, ella con la institucion viene trabajando 15 años se siente muy contenta, gracias al apoyo pudo darles un buena calidad de vida sus hijos mayores, ella se dedica a la venta de productos por temporada ahora se prepara pra el negocio ya que se pronto se celebra el dia de la madre y con el prestamo que le dieron comprará ropa y productos de belleza para vender asus clientes. Seguira trabajando y ayudando a su esposo con los gastos de su pequeño hijo.
texts.en: Nancy belongs to the community bank "Activo de Vitarte", located in the district of Vitarte. This bank is comprised of 7 members who are all women who have a great desire to be successful in their businesses. One of them is Nancy, who is 45 years old, married, and has 3 children, 2 of whom are grown up and one who is in high school. She has been working with the institution for 15 years and is very happy with it. Thanks to their support, she has been able to give her older children a better quality of life. She works selling seasonal products and she is currently preparing her business for Mother's Day. She will use the loan to buy clothes and beauty products to sell to her customers. She will keep working and helping her husband with the expenses for their little boy.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Yessenia Margarita

texts.es:
EL Banco La Dolorosa que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por las extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Yessenia, tiene 34 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 8 años, también tiene otra hija de una relación pasada la cual tiene 14 años, ambos viven en su casa y estudian en colegio y escuela. Su marido es comerciante.

Ella para ganarse el sustento diario sin depender de nadie se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas de yuca y de maíz, tortillas que son un plato típico de esta localidad,  tiene un pequeño local en la vía principal que une  a Jipijapa con la ciudad de Portoviejo por lo cual muchas personas que transitan por esta vía se paran a degustar sus tortillas, las cuales  son las mejores del lugar ya que ella le da un sabor especial, lleva más de 7 años con este negocio, trabaja sola y a veces con la ayuda de su hija mayor.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar maíz, yuca, queso y otros víveres necesarios para elaborar sus tortillas. Es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y fáciles de pagar.
 
Su sueño es seguir aumentando y mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
The “La Dolorosa” communal bank meets every fifteen days in Jipijapa Canton, a canton known as “Sultana del Café” because of the extensive coffee plantations of incomparably flavored coffee and for its cuisine and the warm-heartedness of its people.

Yessenia, 34, lives in this place.  She’s in a common law relationship and has an 8 year old son.  She also has a daughter from her previous relationship who’s 14 years old.  Both live in her house and attend secondary and elementary schools.  Her husband’s a merchant.

To earn daily sustenance not dependent on anyone else, she makes manioc and corn tortillas to sell; it’s a food typical  of the region.  She has a small locale on the main road joining Jipijapa to the city of Portoviejo so many people passing by on this road stop to enjoy her tortillas which are the best in the place because she imparts them with a special flavor.  She’s been in business more than 7 years.  She works alone though sometimes with the help of her oldest daughter.

This new loan will be used to buy corn, manioc, cheese and other foodstuffs needed to make her tortillas.  It’s her fourth cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because the loans are quick and easy to repay.  Her dream is to continue increasing and improving her business.

loans.use: to buy corn, manioc, cheese and other foodstuffs.

loans.name: Dondéma

texts.fr: Revendeur de charbon de bois depuis 2011, Dondéma est un homme âgé de 45ans. Sa femme est professeur et ils ont ensemble 03 enfants dont 02 enfants à l’école. Le premier a 08ans et le dernier 02ans. Il exerce son activité à la maison et s’approvisionne à Lomé et dans les localités du pays. Il est à son premier crédit de WAGES et cet argent lui servira à acheter des sacs de charbons de bois. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité, assurer sa prospérité. Il veut aussi assurer l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en: Retailer of wood charcoal since 2011, Dondéma is a 45 year old man. His wife is a teacher and the couple has 3 children together, two of the children go to school. The oldest is 8 years old and the youngest is 2 years old. He practices this activity from his home and gets his stock from Lomé and other localities in the country. This is his first credit with WAGES and the money will be used to purchases sacks of wood charcoal. He wants to reinvest in this endeavor to ensure its prosperity. He also wants to ensure the personal fulfillment of his family.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of wood coal.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos  es un hombre de 53 años de edad, de estado civil casado y con 2 hijos a su cargo, Vive  en casa  propia  con sus hijos. La casa está ubicada en el Caserío Tierras Duras del distrito de La Matanza y cuenta con servicio de luz, agua, el lugar es una comunidad  de aproximadamente 80 familias.
La actividad que desarrolla Santos es la venta de pescado y transporte de pasajeros en mototaxi propia del cliente,  y el pescado lo vende en el mercado local de la zona; también se dedica a la agricultura  posee su terreno  (1.0 has) y tiene instalado fréjol variedad zarandaja, donde presenta buen desarrollo fenològico. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 20 años aproximadamente,  y aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. 
El monto del crédito solicitado   es de 1500 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán para invertir en  la compra de pesticidas, bioestimulantes y pago de jornales   del cultivo, lo cual le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Santos is a 53 year old man who has a common-law wife and 2 children. He lives in his own house with his children. The house is located in Caserío Tierras Duras in the district of La Matanza and has electrical service and town water. The place is a community of approximately 80 families. Santos works selling fish and transporting passengers in a motorcycle-taxi. He sells the fish in the local market. He also works as a farmer and has 1 hectare of land where he grows the zarandaja variety of bean, which grow well. He has been doing this for about 20 years and he learned farming from his parents. It could be said that he knows this work perfectly. 
The amount of the requested loan is $575, which he will use to buy pesticides, fertilizer, and to pay the laborers for their work. This will enable him to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, fertilizer, and to pay the laborers for their work.

loans.name: G.s. Chavarria Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Chavarría está conformado por dos emprendedoras que ya han venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000, durante el crédito las emprendedoras han demostrado ser responsable y con deseos de superación, las emprendedoras nos expresan que con el financiamiento han aumentado su inversión y sus clientes. Juana Del Carmen es parte de este grupo y está solicitando nuevamente financiamiento para la compra de granos básicos, aceite, verduras, jabón, detergente entre otros productos que le solicitan sus clientes.
texts.en: The loan group Chavarría is comprised of two entrepreneurs who have already been working with Fundación León since 2000. Through their loans, the entrepreneurs have shown themselves to be responsible and ambitious. The entrepreneurs tell us that, with their previous loans, they have increased their investment and their customers. Juana Del Carmen is part of the group and she is requesting a new loan to buy staple grains, oil, vegetables, soap, detergent, and other products that her customers request.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, oil, vegetables, soap, detergente and other products that her customers request.

loans.name: Mónica Narcisa

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Lideres Del Mañana que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Pajan,  cantón conocido por ser una zona muy ganadera de la provincia, un atractivo es el rodeo montubio que organizan en algunas épocas del año. 

En este lugar vive la señora Mónica, tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 15 años y un bebé de 8 meses, el mayor estudia en colegio. Está desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han brindado en todo este tiempo para salir adelante con esta dura carga de ser madre soltera.

Ella para ganarse la vida y para que a sus hijos nunca les falte nada desde hace varios años se dedica a preparar y vender comida, todos los días prepara almuerzos los mismos que vende en su casa o entregar en  ciertas instituciones. Los fines de semana también prepara comida para fiestas, y esto es por lo general casi todas las semanas.
  
Este crédito es para comprar carne, pescado y otros víveres para preparar los alimentos.
 
Su sueño es que a sus hijos nunca les falte nada.
texts.en:
The “Líderes Del Mañana” (Tomorrow’s Leaders) communal bank meets every fifteen days in Pajan Canton, a canton known for being a very livestock oriented zone in the province.  One of the attractions is the country rodeo that takes place in certain times of the year.

Mónica lives here.  She’s 39 years old and the single mother of two children, a 15-year-old and an 8 month old baby; the older one attends school.  She’s been in the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because of the help she’s gotten all this time to get ahead with the heavy load of being a single mother.

To earn her livelihood and so that her children would never lack anything, she’s been making food to sell for several years.  She makes lunches every day that she either sells at home or delivers to certain institutions.  On weekends she also prepares food for parties and this is in general almost every week.

This loan is to buy meat, fish and other ingredients to prepare the meals.  Her dream is that her children never lack anything.

loans.use: to buy meat, fish and other ingredients.

loans.name: Normadia

texts.en:
Normadia is 49 years old and married with 6 children. With 2 children in school, Normadia works very hard to provide for them.

Normadia runs a business buying and selling nipa (woven palm mats) in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Normadia has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Normadia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her children.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Khut

texts.en:
Khut has just come to HKL for the first time to gain access to financial services to improve her business and living. She is a 59 year old married woman who has been residing in Reussey Keo district, Phnom Penh. She manages her rice farming business along with her husband on her existing inherited farmland. She has been doing this business for more than 20 years. She spends most of her income on daily sustenance and her children’s education. She has five children. Two of the children works for a garment factory to help the family.

With the amount she has requested, Khut would like to buy extra farmland to further expand her business. She said that she will be able to increase her rice production and household income through using this loan. She wants to save the income she’ll generate for her children’s future education and for the emergencies of the family.

loans.use: to buy extra farmland to further expand her business.

loans.name: Omar Antonio

texts.es: El señor Omar es originario de Granada, casado,  tiene 3 hijas una de 12, 7 y 3 años de edad.  El es comerciante se desempeña en la elaboración de joyas actividad que inicio luego de dejar de trabajar con su papa en esa misma actividad  a los 26 años ya que se caso decidió independizarse y busco  como generar ingreso para su hogar, este ha sido su primer negocio, no cuenta con el apoyo de  alguien  pues saca su negocio adelante el solo,  sus prendas las comercializa en su casa  ya que cuenta con clientes que llegan a comprarle. Tiene otros ingresos los generados por su esposa quien tiene una tienda de ropa nueva en el mercado, sus planes futuros es expandirse a Costa rica ya que es un buen mercado.  Solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería tales como oro , plata y piedras el  cual estima  este crédito le ayudara ya que le  permitirá incrementar sus ventas al igual que sus ingresos, sus metas próximas es poder expandirse a otros países y seguir trabajando para poder cumplir sus planes a futuro.
texts.en:
Omar is from Granada.  He’s married and has three daughters who are 12, 7 and 3 years old.  He’s a merchant.  He works making jewelry, an activity he started when he stopped working with his father in the same activity at the age of 26; he decided to become independent and looked for a way to earn income for his home.  This has been his first business.  He does not have help from anyone else; he runs his business by himself.  He sells his items at home since he has customers that come by to purchase from him.  He also has other income that’s generated by his wife who has a new clothes store in the market.  His future plan is to expand into Costa Rica because it’s a good market.

He’s asking for the loan to buy merchandise like gold, silver and gem stones.  He feels that this loan will help him because it will allow him to increase sales as well as income.  His next goal is to be able to expand into other countries and to continue working to meet his future goals.

loans.use: to buy gold, silver and gem stones.

loans.name: Jose Tomas

texts.es: El señor Tomas es originario de Granada, casado, tiene 4 hijos los cuales son mayores de edad  de vida independiente, el es comerciante se dedica a la elaboración de joyas. Inicio  su actividad a la edad de 20 años cuando formo su hogar se vio en la necesidad de generar ingresos para la manutención de su familia, en el negocio recibe el apoyo de uno de sus hijos, su producto lo comercializa en todo Granada. Cuenta con otros ingresos los provenientes de un trabajo que le realiza a un hotel en lavandería, le gustaría expandirse a los departamentos para vender a un mejor precio. Solicita el  crédito para compra de materia prima como oro y plata todo lo necesario para la elaboración de joyas, este crédito le ayudara ya que le permitirá incrementar su mercadería mejorando asi sus ventas y su ingreso, su meta próxima es seguir trabajando para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Tomás is from Granada.  He’s married and has four children who are all adults and live independently.  He’s a merchant.  He manufactures jewelry.  He started his activity at the age of 20 when he formed his own home and needed to generate income to feed his family.  One of his children helps him in the business and he sells his items throughout Granada.  He also earns additional income from a job he has working in a hotel laundry.  He’d like to expand into the departments to sell at better prices.

He’s requesting the loan to buy raw materials like gold and silver and everything needed to manufacture jewelry.  This loan will help him in that it will allow him to increase merchandise thus improving sales and income.  His next goal is to continue working to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy gold and silver.
